Reviews.Title: “Great pool & clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bpfeiffer
Reviews.Content: Very busy at Easter time, but clean rooms, great pool, and tiki bar by the pool made it all better. Check-in was very easy and rooms were easy to get to. Kids swam at night and all next day until extended check-out. Had fun meeting international guests that were going to Magic Kingdom. Breakfast was good but PACKED. Staff did their best to try and keep up with demands. Once the mob left for Orlando, hotel was very peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World Trip”
Reviews.Author: kkstump
Reviews.Content: We were given a room on the first floor but after we entered, the room smelled like mildew (probably from the guests entering the room wet from the pool). We went to the front desk and asked for a different room and the receptionist was very accommodating. The internet and the parking were free so that was a plus (internet was weak in the rooms but if you went to the main lobby the connection was better). The continental breakfast was filling and they had a lot of variety to choose from and it was FREE. You get what you pay for and our expectations were not high since it's not a 4 or 5 star hotel. The pool was relaxing after a long day at Disney World. They have a shuttle that leaves really early, I think it leaves around 7:30 in the morning but we chose to drive since we were guests of a Disney employee (free parking). Overall, the hotel was great and our room was clean. I have stayed at Comfort Suites before so I would stay again at this one. FYI, the kiddie pool was freezing but the big pool was nice and warm. That was the only setback for us since our 4 year old wanted to play in the kid's pool.

Reviews.Title: “Quality on a budget”
Reviews.Author: dropusaline
Reviews.Content: As of April 1 2012 the name changes to the Clarion. Our family with kids aged 10 and 7 just got back from a 10 day stay April 9-19 2012. I have absolutely nothing bad to say. I was pleasantly suprised. I guess I was expecting a shadier place because of how inexpensive it was. Breakfast: A hot breakfast was included daily, which included 3 kinds of cereal, 2 kinds of milk, yogurt, fruit cup, cofffffee, hot chocolate, tea, oatmeal, various juices, bread, bagels, english muffins, cream cheese, peanut butter, jam and butter, fresh fruit ready to bring with you, pastries, bacon or sausage, a new variety of egg preparation daily (hard boiled, scrambled, egg pancake) waffles 2 varieties you cook yourself one shaped like Mickey. The breakfast room was off the lobby and was airy, clean and quite large, there is also an outdoor seating area. Attendants are there constantly refilling stock and cleaning as needed. Internet: WIFI was also included but the signal was not all that strong sometimes to be honest. Rooms: The rooms were large and clean, the bathroom was larger than needed, there was a minisafe, a mini fridge and a microwave. There was an armoir for your clothes but I do wish there were more drawers so we could have unpacked the suitcases instead of living out of them. Pool: The pool area was fantastic but more chairs are needed. Towels are provided but they are the small hospital type with the blue line down the middle so bring your own. The pool is configured in such a way that shallow and deep areas are blended together without a real clear idea of where they are unless you read the depth tile. Ok the information is there, but parents beware..there is a shallow end but no buoy line which would have been nice. Laundry: Facilities per floor (3) The laundry room had 3 washers and 3 dryers. Both were very clean. There was a folding area.$3.00 was the cost for a wash and dry, The cycle was quite long enough to dry your clothes without adding more time. Location: Mile marker 4. The hotel is very near to the Walt Disney Parks. We were not more than 12 minutes away from any park. Great location. There was a grocery store, restaurants, liquor store and pharmacy right nearby. For the price ( which for us was 64$ per night with breakfast included) was a very good bang for the buck. I would stay again if I was looking for an inexpensive hotel near the Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: rochesterjc
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at Comfort Suites(now Clarion Suites) and found it to be clean and comfortable. Calling the rooms "suites" is a bit of a stretch, but still worked well for my family of 4. The breakfast was basic, but good. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You Get Exactly What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: whitecourt
Reviews.Content: Most of the hotels on US 192 are a little bit dated and I would say they are about 3 stars. We stayed at the Comfort Inn Suites (make sure you know which one you’re staying in cause there are more than one with in a ten mile radius, ours was located at 7888 W Irlo Bronson Hwy) March 2012, a party of four (2 adults & 2 teens). There is nothing special about this property but it is kept clean, the morning breakfast included is more than enough, the staff seem friendly enough and the rate per night is consistent with what you get (pictures attached). So if you’re a snobby kind of person who expects a 5 star resort, remember the rate you paid, that should bring you down to earth. From where the hotel is situated it’s quite easy to get to and from all the theme parks at Disney and Universal Studios by car. I found that paying a little less for a hotel and renting a car was worth it, cause after paying for parking ($14.00 per day) I was able to go between parks when ever I decided to with no trouble, and if anyone wanted to go shopping or any other activity the car provide that flexibility. There are a few spots to eat at within a block of the hotel,(Out Back, Carrabba’s, Applebee’s, Red Lobster, TGIF etc.) so you can walk there. There is no truth to what many hotels claim as to the distance their hotel is from the Disney park. Some say they are situated .2 miles or .6 miles etc. it simply is not even close to the truth, and this hotel is no exception. It’s about 6-7 miles to the Magic Kingdom park gates So if you’re staying at the Disney hotels, transportation to the different parks is included, but if you’re staying off property then renting a car (bring a portable navigator cause the roads systems are crazy) is a good option because the shuttles provided by the hotels don’t run very often in most cases. That being said, once you’re at the park and you have a park hopper pass they do have buses to take you from one park to another We stayed a few days at the Quality Royale Parc Suites, next to old town about 4 miles down the road from comfort suites, again nothing special (3 star), kept clean, morning breakfast included and for $134.00 per night we rented a 2 bdrm suite so everyone had their own bed and two bathrooms which is nice if you have teenage girls. There is a 7/11 next door for snacks and a few restaurants close by for dinner. If you have smaller kids there is a small amusement park about 11/2 blocks away with some rides for older kids as well and no line ups. Old town is a collection of shops mostly souvenirs and a few bars, on Friday and Saturday they have this show and shine for the car enthusiast. Again it’s easy to get to and from the theme parks from this property. To sum up you can pay $400.00 to $600.00 a night for Disney properties, but we were in our hotel room a whopping 8 hours a night cause if you wanted to beat the crowds your usually at the parks by the time they open and back later at night, so paying a lot for a room to sleep in seems pointless. I have some tips and opinions on the theme parks just let me know I’ll email you back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay super close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Christine E
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great holiday in Florida. We spent 7 days at the Maingate - great experience. The room was quite big and clean and the internet worked fine. We were on the 3rd floor and a corner room. The staff was nice and friendly and the continental breakfast was great and if you found it crowded you could go out on the deck and enjoy breakfast. They had a computer and printer so we were able to print our boarding passes. Thanks Comfort Suites Maingate for a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay super close to the Magic Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: robngaby
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a great holiday in Florida. Our first leg involved a few days stay at the Maingate - great experience. The room was very clean and quite big (ours was suite-ish - it had a partition (half wall - wish it was a solid wall!) between the kids' beds and the sofa bed so momma and I could talk and play on the iPhone after the kids went to bed. Breakfast was a mad house but the attendants were very nice and worked hard to keep everything stocked. The buffet featured some sort of egg, a meat dish and waffle (Mickey Mouse shaped!) maker along with the usual continental...just fine. Before 7 there was no one there. Pool was a bit cool (kiddie pool was freezing) but fine on hot days. We bought our Disney passes from the concierge (after surfing the net for weeks beforehand, it turned out we never found much more than ~$50 difference for all 5 passes). Hotel was about 10 minutes to Disney. We liked that it had a shuttle but found for the $14 parking fee it was just as easy to drive. Carrabba's was AWESOME - had to wait for around 45 to get in but we got there at 6pm so no big surprise and worth the wait. Giordanno's was OK - little issue with a lost order but the food was good and portions were big. Best secret was there's a Winn Dixie right beside (plus bagel place, liquor store and a Red Box movie rental outlet in front of Winn Dixie). We bought some sandwiches, fruit and water to take to the park and saved a bundle. Thumbs up to the Comfort Suites Maingate!

Reviews.Title: “Badly named Comfort Suites”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Virgin Holidays traveler
Reviews.Content: This is not a hotel, a motel at best. The rooms are tired and quite basic, the kitchette had no crockery, cutlery or utensils and the walls are wafer thin, at times we felt we were in with the folks next door during their arguments and heated discussions. The pool area and bar was again basic and univiting with the bar not open until 3pm(there is no other Restaurant or Cafe).The breakfast buffet left much to be desired if you could get a seat, normally very crowded, only polystyrene plates and cups and plastic cutlery again very motel like. A cheap hotel with unhelpful staff except the room maids who were excellent and kept the rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Seekin Information”
Reviews.Author: calvin c
Reviews.Content: My wife an I are considering this hotel for two weeks in March and would like to know if some rooms are better then others also do they serve a full breakfast??...thanks

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: NatureFairymom
Reviews.Content: Just back from a week in Orlando, family vacation with 9 y/o. Stayed at Comfort Suites. On the good side - breakfast buffet had good variety, place was clean overall, walking distance to mini golf, many chains for evening meals (red lobster, outback etc), small supermarket near by and all hotel staff were very friendly and helpful, pool was nice and warm. On the bad side, both rooms ( we had to switch on the second night) were a bit musty smelling, wifi never really worked in the room on iPad, or iPod, fridge and blowdryer didn't work in first room. Then there's the shuttle ... Good - they have one to all the parks - it leaves hotel at 7:30 ish for most destinations and return starting at 5:30 ( sometimes there is one return time sometimes more depending on which park you go to ... Disney MK, Epcot, animal,etc. universal,sea world etc. The shuttles run on time but it makes for long days often dropping you off before the park opens. Hotel is close enough to return by taxi fairly inexpensively from the Disney parks but good luck finding a taxi ( you need to get a few taxi numbers and have them on hand so you can call one from the park - taxis do NOT sit at the taxi stand and will NOT pick up a fare if you attempt to flag down one that is dropping off passengers. Shuttle to the "outlet" mall - is also available from the hotel. It takes you to the Lake Buena Vista Outlets I think they were called. Word to the wise - this is NOT an outlet mall in any sense of the word. About half the stores are just stores. There are a few outlets but the pricing ( with the exception of Fossil and maybe one or two others) is not outlet pricing. The Disney and Character outlet stores are tiny with very limited product. There are two other real outlet malls on International Drive. They are however a pretty hefty taxi fare from the hotel. You can get to them on the cheap if you take the shuttle to Seaworld and then catch the I -trolley at sea world which run a continuous loop on International Drive. This would mean making a day of it though as the shuttle leaves the hotel for sea world at 7:30 and returns in the evening. One final note on getting around from the hotel - if you want to go to downtown Disney (which is really cool too). Catch the shuttle from the hotel to magic kingdom ( it has the best schedule) - it will drop you at the TTC - walk to the Polynesian Resort ( less than 5 min) and catch one of the Disney busses to downtown. They leave from all of the resorts but the Polynesian is the easiest to get to. The day we did Downtown Disney we also played on the monorail to get an aerial view of some of the parks (cool for the under 10 set). For us the hotel was ok - it was a last minute trip and I didn't want to spend a fortune and when you get down to it all we really did was sleep there and eat breakfast. The wifi was the biggest pain as I had planned to go on line each night to get the next days maps tickets plans etc.

Reviews.Title: “COMFORT INN SUITE, FLORIDA”
Reviews.Author: seashell_ohio
Reviews.Content: Very nice check-in staff. Were able to get a king suite by the pool with Choice reward points Location was great, near resturants and shopping. Morning breakfast was more than plentyful. Nice pool bar open every day @ 4:00. Good pool area with nice shade.

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: KAF32082
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on reviews, because it was a Choice Hotels, and because it had a hot tub- I have had back problems and wanted a hot tub. When we checked in, I was told the hot tub wasn't working. I told the desk staff that we'd then go to another hotel as we only wanted this hotel for the hot tub. The desk staff said though my credit card wouldn't be billed until the next day, she could not stop the charge on my card. I asked for a manager. I was told no manager was available by phone or otherwise for 3 days; I was told the best I could do was file a complaint/dispute about the charge later. We decided to stay in fear we'd end up paying for two hotels- no apology by staff, no offer to compensate, no statement that management would be advised or the hot tub would be fixed. In the morning when checking out, we told the front desk staff again, and this time got 10% off our bill for the trouble. This isn't what we had wanted, though- we wanted the hot tub working or confirmation the night before that we would not be billed so we could go elsewhere. I wrote a letter to the assistant manager when I got home, with no response. Also, the breakfast room had no seating available when we went and we had to eat in the lobby. I recommend that you go somewhere else. This place does not value its guests and has incredibly poor management and customer service.

Reviews.Title: “spend a few more bucks and go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: P0P60713
Reviews.Content: I wish I spent a little bit more and stayed somewhere else. Based on most of the reviews we decided to stay here. Positive: -good breakfast choices compared to others. -Nice location, pretty close to a bunch of restaurant, gift shops, etc -Kim at all guest services was friendly and gave great advice on things to do Cons: -Poor customer service. Except for one lady who was always smiling at the front desk everybody else we encountered was rude. I called front desk and even before I finished the guy hunged up on me. Is it better if you ask in person, not really. They look so annoyed that you're bothering them. -Maybe some rooms are clean but ours wasn't. There was something sticky on the carpet and there's this weird musty smell inside the room. You have to turn the AC full blast to get rid of the smell. Good thing I had some lysol wipes, the bathroom was dirty when we got there. -WiFi worked maybe 40% of the time. Cable went down as well. TV sucks since it's an old box type late 80's tv so definitely no HD. Bad reception on most of the channels including the local channels. Even their own maintenance guy said so when we mentioned it. -Limited shuttle schedule and was late most of the time. Sometimes they have a small shuttle and a lot of people just standing. -As one person stated, the breakfast area is pretty small. Just grab some food when you can and eat in your room. That's the best option. They need to clean the juice dispenser after what we saw some guest doing. Pretty disgusting! -Worse thing was when this cochroach fell on us from the second floor on our way to get breakfast. If you're not picky and just need a place to crash then this is fine. If you want some sort of service and a cozy room I'd go elsewhere. A few people we met during our stay had the same complaint. Everything here is outdated. They should redo their carpet and chage some of the furniture esp the one with stains. Oh yeah, what's up with the cleaning guy just throwing all the bottles he found on the ditch behind the hotel. Not only did the glass shatter but don't they have a recycle bin?

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not great”
Reviews.Author: maryellen57
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in this hotel with my family and have a few observations. I'll start with the positives. The rooms are very clean and spacious, with plenty of room for the four of us. Beds were very comfortable, even the sofa bed (which was very clean by the way). The complimentary breakfast is great, with good choices. Location is perfect. Overall, its a very nice hotel. Now the negatives. The breakfast area is EXTREMELY small for an hotel this size. It's very hard to find a table around 9-9:30. Our shower was clogged and so it would fill up with water very quickly. Wi-fi service was spotty, but it worked about 75% percent of the time we were in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: Papi20145
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews i was a bit undecided . But took a chance .I like to read the good with the bad and compare the percentages .I notice some of the negatives were a little dated .We booked this property on Booking.com and got a non refundable 49 dollar rate. I was pleasantly surprised, our room was a double queen,micro wave ,fridge, 32 in flat screen. the room was very clean and had plenty of space.And a large bathroom.The room came with full breakfast ,which is not extensive but did give families on the way to the parks a good head start. Also received 2 for 1 drink coupons at the pool cabana.The staff was very nice and attentive.All in all a very good experience for this Comfort Suites. Highly recommend this location.thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Pool not heated”
Reviews.Author: chrsy2000
Reviews.Content: The pool is supposedly heated to 80 degrees, but was way too cold to get in just about every day, despite outside temperatures in the 80's. i have been to Florida in January before, where the outside temperature was in the 60's and was able to swim in other hotels with pools heated warmly.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: kuhanamy
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely located close to Disney shops and places to eat. Michelle the host at the Cabana Bar was awesome and provided superior service! The shuttle to the parks was nice too and a great breakfast all at an incredible value! If I had a complaint it would only be one...the small square pillows. I guess it is standard now, but I like a big fluffily pillow :)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ocean City, New Jersey, United States
Reviews.Title: “Worry-free stay”
Reviews.Author: Penguin1968
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 night complimentary stay for donating my old car. No problems at this motel, clean and friendly staff, spacious suite and nice pool area. Shuttle service to the parks a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Baseball Trip in December 2011”
Reviews.Author: mark w
Reviews.Content: We traveled to this Hotel from Ohio for a baseball tournament at Disney. Hotel was awesome kids had a blast in pool, adults loved the cabana bar ,Michelle was an awesome bartender made our evenings enjoyable........Front desk clerks at check in were not the best,,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Clean Covenient and Fun”
Reviews.Author: Thomas T
Reviews.Content: This past December was my third year staying at this hotel with the Bradford Huskies Cross Country Team. The hotel is clean and convenient to all the Orlando attractions and convenient to stores, local restaurants and shops. The kids love the pool and Michelle the bartender at the poolside cabana bar is the best. Michelle made the trip both fun and relaxing for the parents with her excellant service and great personality.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as it looks”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: At check-in (6pm) I saw the hotel had 3 floors, we have 1 family member afraid of heights. We were given a 3rd floor room & requested a lower floor. We were told the hotel just got a new computer system and it was impossible for them to switch our room because the computer automatically assigned rooms and they could not be changed. I asked if there was a manager I could speak to and she said, "no there's not" . Really? No Manager on duty?? The so-called "poolview" room we reserved only had a view of the back of the cabana and it's hvac and pipes, not the pool. Additionally, the first night of our stay, we attempted to visit the pool and hot tub, however, there was a large group of teenagers from Ohio staying and they, along with their chaperones, were having a "party". The adults were at the bar drinking and the kids were all in the hot tub, splashing and throwing each other around. I got sat on once by one of these kids. There were red plastic party cups at the bottom of the pool from their party and they were using some of the cups to splash each other in the hot tub. Their pizza boxes were stacked up in the pool area as well. Not a very inviting situation for a family just wanting to relax. This got our vacation off to a poor start. The bad attititude of the staff and their lack of willingness to assist us left a terrible impression. We will not be back to this hotel. Unfortunately, we wasted our rewards points on this pitiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Thanks”
Reviews.Author: petedesormeaux
Reviews.Content: As a parent of the Bradford Huskies Cross Country team recently stayed ay th Comfort Suites Maingate. This was my first year there and having heard of all the great responses from all the parents the Hotel was impeccable and and the staff was extremely helpful if i/we needed anything there was no hesitation in helping us. And Michelle was Awesome!!!!!! she was great with the kids and her service to the parents was great whatever we wanted she would make it which was great. Impeccable service..... Rooms were always clean and staff was simply Awesome Kudos to them all!!!!!!! Thanks again and i would stay again for sure :)

Reviews.Title: “One night stay for Disney Christmas lights”
Reviews.Author: Kevin K
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel ( had cleaned the carpets the day before our arrival) with nice grounds. Awesome breakfast - chocolate Mickey waffles! Not a great experience with front desk, not as friendly and professional as I have experienced at other hotels of this chain. Good location with plenty of restaurants around. Great place for family with young children.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!!!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew902
Reviews.Content: The Bradford Huskies Cross Country team recently stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate for the third year in a row during our competition at ESPN Wide World of Sports. They continue to be wonderful! The front desk was very helpful and accommodating. We had 37 children with us and the staff was great towards them. Michelle was spectacular again - the kids loved her smoothies - and her service to the parents, too, was impeccable. The sales manager was great. Rooms were clean. There were a few minor issues upon arrival, but maintenance was quick to rectify any issues. Thank you again for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Clothes stolen from my room!”
Reviews.Author: Julie B
Reviews.Content: I checked into Comfort Inn Maingate on Thursday Nov 24th and headed to Miami for the night. When I came back from Miami, I woke up the next morning and realized two of my designer shirts ($450 value) I left in the closet were missing. My other shirts that were hanging in the closet were moved around (almost seemed as if the cleaning ladies had tried them all on and took their favourites). My husband called the front desk and we were told the general manager would not be in until Monday and there's nothing that they could do. I told them that I refused to stay at the hotel because I felt unsafe (they didn't care). They told me to call back on Monday to speak to the general manager. By Monday I had already left the hotel and stayed with family because I was afraid something else would happen. I asked the lady at the front desk to tell the GM to call ME on my cell phone, but obviously she didnt. I called on Monday and again the general manager "wasn't there" and had "left for the day". I had to raise my voice at the girl at reception and tell her that this is unacceptable and I want the GM to call me! A few minutes later the GM called me (surprise surprise, I guess she didn't leave for the day). She apologized for what happened, said she needs to make sure that the cleaning girl did infact take my shirts because she wasn't admitting to it (even after the head of housekeeping told me it wasn't anyone external that came into the room, it must be the cleaning ladies). I demanded my money back for the shirts and for my stay at the Comfort Inn, but they only said they would give me back my money for the shirts. Apparently the house keepers are an outside company that cleans for the Comfort Inn so I was given a phone number to the manager of the cleaning company to be reimbursed for my shirts. I called him and he was "on the road" and promised to call me back in 20 minutes. After 30mins, one of his employees called me and said they are investigating and they will reimburse me the money for the shirts if infact their employee was found guilty. I returned home on Tuesday and have been contacting the cleaning company to reimburse me for my shirts, but they keep saying "ooh sorry we're really busy, let me call you back". In addition, Comfort Inn Maingate refuses to reimburse me for my stay there and considering I didn't stay there because I felt unsafe due to the incident, I expect reimbursement and will be contacting the corporate department regarding this issue. They did not care that my shirts were stolen and did not make me feel comfortable staying there one bit. I definitely do NOT recommend staying at this hotel unless you want the cleaners stealing/trying on your clothes. If you do decide to stay at this hotel, do not bring anything valuable. We were told by a lot of people at the malls not to leave valuables in your car as well. If you do go shopping, do NOT unload your purchases in your vehicle because your car will get broken into. In addition, be aware that most locals do not speak a word of English!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Disney and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sparklespan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night at this hotel on the 24th after a trip to Disney Magic Kingdom. It is also not far a drive if you plan to go to Legoland the next day. It is about 50min drive. I used my Choice Hotel Reward Points to redeem the stay. Booked a 2 Queen with a sofa bed suite and able to fit 6 people in the room. It has a pool view. Very clean , quiet and well lit. All the staff are very friendly over the phone and in person. Fast and easy check-in and check-out. Pros - Convenient to attractions, restaurants, convenient or shopping areas for souvenirs. Great b/f. Big eating area and a very nice heated pool. We did not use it but it will be great for summer stay. Free WiFi, coffee, fridge, and microwave. Easy to locate this hotel. Also has a location at the lobby area where you can purchase attraction tickets. We did not use this service as we have already purchased our tickets. The room is clean and mostly looked well kept and up to date. Cons - Need to upgrade TV to flat screen. Would be great if the sink is separate from the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Robyn E
Reviews.Content: Michelle in the pool bar was fantastic. She was friendly and helpful and offered fast service. Tomas from maintanence was also extremely helpful and professional. Both should be employees of the month.

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Catherine L
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there for the last eight years. The rooms are very clean and comfortable. The staff always courteous and helpful. Great breakfast. Michelle the bartender made excellent drinks, was very friendly. Tom in maintenance was always busy helping people. Will stay there again.We like the area. Quiet off the road yet your in walking distance to restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: mousejunkiemillers
Reviews.Content: We are season pass holders at Disney and go to the area at least 4 times a year always staying outside Disney. We use to stay at seralargo but it got run down needs updating so we ventured out to other places A's you can see with my other reviews some were a nightmare but then we found this hidden little gem. Tucked away behind a crackle barrel next to a strip mall it this beautiful gem comfort suites. It has the old fashion feel of family motel style stays but beautifully renovated fresh clean and what a pool the breakfast which includes waffles in the shape of Mickey is a big hit with the kids the staff is friendly and the prices are great. I hope it never changes. The crackle barrel is right there across the parking lot there is a subway in the strip mall a bagel store a grocery store that sells seasonal items like floats ect... We are coming back for a week on nov. 14th. This is our new regular place !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: msa1164
Reviews.Content: We stay at this hotel in mid Oct 2011. Nice room, good breakfast buffet. Room was clean and comfortable - no suprises. Pool area looked really great but we did not use it. We did leave jewelry in the room and it was promptly returned to the front! For this we are very thankful - honest staff! Checkin took a bit long, but this was due to some need checkins, not the two clerks working the desk. All in all, nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great value, very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Jason K
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the reviews of this hotel prior to my visit and with this being a once in a lifetime type trip for me and my 2 daughters I did have a few concerns but after arriving my concerns were put to rest. We checked in on October 19/11 and check-in was easy, the Front Desk Clerk "Ted" was excellent to deal with, and made the process excellent. We went to our room (2 queen beds, 3rd floor facing the pool) and it was clean, beds were very comfortable which made me quite happy as my back is very bed sensitive. We immediately went to the grocery store and grabbed some milk, bottled water, pop and other snack stuff to fill the nice sized fridge the room had. The electronic safe was a nice touch also which we stored our travel documents/passports in. The breakfast was, as so many people have said, excellent, there was everything you could want, Mickey Mouse &or regular shaped waffles, cereal, toast/bagels, pastries, coffee, tea, yogurt, juices, even some hot egg dishes...and of course it was a busy area, to be expected whenever you offer a whole hotel something complimentary. Pool/hot tub was very nice. Location was nice for me and offered a nice 20 min or so drive to pretty much all attractions. Having the room we did as "home base" for our week made things all the much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: fhcandles
Reviews.Content: Checked in 10/22/11 it around 8 pm. Check in was easy no problems. When to my room and when I opened the door the stench was terrible, it reaked of urine. I ccalled down to front desk and told of the problem and I was told, there were no other rooms avail. She suggested that I turn the air conditioner on to air out the room. I did that and went out to dinner, came back no better. The closer you got to the bathroom the worse it got. The base of the toliet needed to be bleached as it was pretty disgusting. I was told they would send maintenance up to see what he could do about the smell. I asked what can he do, is he going to clean? I was then told no he would not be cleaning, and there wasn't anything they could do. Front desk told me she would talk to the night auditor and see about adjusting my bill. The bedspreads were stained and a big ole dead roach was laying on the floor along side of the bed and it had been there awhile, because when I went to remove it, it was all dryed out. The carpet was filthy and my bare feet turned black. I could not wait to check out of the room, and get some fresh air. If I had'nt had a small child with me, I would have never stayed but it was late at night. The next morning when I went to check out I asked to speak to the manager, but was told manager was not working that day. I then asked if she had talked to the night auditor about adjusting my bill, she said no and then said she didn't know what to tell me. I will never ever go back. I am by no means a picky person, but, the room I had smelled sooo bad and was dirty.

Reviews.Title: “good value and clean”
Reviews.Author: summ1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the staff both friendly and helpfull, The free van service to the parks was always on time. A real plus was the location of many good resturants within short walking distance of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, big and a free shuttle bus to disney”
Reviews.Author: Skoda12
Reviews.Content: Realy enjoyed our stay here, theybprovide you withna free shuttle bus (runs early morn and late evening) and has a family friendly pool and bar.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Great Friendly Staff, Clean and Comfortable!!!”
Reviews.Author: tombaby1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times and each has been Great!! The Pool/Tike Bar is a friendly place to just relax.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: GMF-Aruba
Reviews.Content: Great service, friendly people what else can I say??Breakfast in the morning was also great, allot of food!!! Tnx to Mario and Luz for the great service, we re highly satisfied :D,And off course we will come back anytime!!! We felt at home away from home, Tnx guys from your friend Humphrey Francisco ( Tiger TaeKwodo,Aruba )

Reviews.Title: “Torn on a review”
Reviews.Author: nsgrimm
Reviews.Content: I am torn on how to rate this hotel based on our experience here. At first I loved this hotel, friendly staff, big and clean rooms, very nice pool area! We stayed the night, no issues. Until the next morning. We were staying on the backside of the hotel on the first floor. My family had gone to Disney for the morning, I stayed behind to finish up some school work. I sat by the pool relaxing and then proceeded to the room to pack all of our belongings up. As I was putting our computer into the bag on the floor I saw something move, it was a snake!!!! I called front desk and they sent people out to remove it. Meantime I was freaking out!!! It was just a baby and I have no clue what kind it was as to me all snakes are horrible. But since it was a baby I was wondering where the mom and siblings were!! My husband, mother, and children arrived just as maintenance was removing the snake and my mom overheard them say that this had been happening recently (finding snakes in rooms). Granted we live in Florida and that comes with the territory. We are returning to Orlando this weekend and had initially decided to stay again at this hotel but now I don't think I can! Honestly the hotel itself was fine, but I can't get the thoughts of that snake being in my room out of my head. If you stay here, request a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor not on the back side of the hotel. Btw, we initially had a 3rd floor room but changed it to a 1st floor because the elevator was out of service.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, clean, close to Disney. What else to ask for?”
Reviews.Author: BarbaritaV
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at this hotel for the last 8 years. It's located close to Disney parks, Downtown Disney, Medieval Times,and many otehr attractions. The people at this hotel are very nice. they do a great job cleaning the rooms and the facility. The braekfast is great and free the best of all. I highly reconmend this place for families or people that are vacationing in the Disney area.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed, good breakfast, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: jandacut
Reviews.Content: Our bed was amazingly comfortable and the breakfast was great. It was close to the Disney parks, so it worked well since that's why we were in the area. The room we stayed in has outside entry doors, so it's a little less safe. It was moderately noisy since there were a lot of families there.

Reviews.Title: “decent breakfast horrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jdf240
Reviews.Content: we stayed here during part of our trip to disney. The carpets were sticky and we had to wear our shoes at all times the couch was all stained. The rooms are very musky and had a smell to them. I mentioned the carpets to the staff and they said they are replacing the carpets in the summer so hopefully they did that. Pool was ok a bit rough on the feet. great location with an update it could be a great place. make sure to go to the breakfast early to avoid delays.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ernieCentralIllinois
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mother for 2 nights. We came down for a family function. I read reviews on tripadvisor before booking the reservation. For the most part, I agreed with most of the reviews. Upon arriving, my first impression was that the paint on the outside of the building is significantly faded, but that's not an issue. The next thing I saw was that there are outside entrances to the rooms, which surprised me. It is definitely an old, old hotel that has been refurbished. Our room was fairly large with a frig and microwave, and both worked well. The carpet had the grimy feel to it that old dirty carpet has. I wore my flip flops around the room. The bathroom was large and the shower and toilet worked well. The room had the musty, odd smell that some other reviews spoke of, but it didn't really bother us. The beds and matresses need to be updated. The mattress was saggy and not the most comfortable, but we were able to sleep fairly well on them. I really like to have a nice comfortable bed so that was probably the worst thing for me. The breakfast was fine and well attended by the staff with cereal, breads, waffles, bacon or sausage, and eggs. It is from 7-10 which just barely gives you enough time to eat before catching the shuttle to Disney-it picks up at 7:30. The breakfast was crowded but we had plenty to eat. The nicest part for me was the pool area. It is very nice with a large, clean pool area with a nice pool bar that opens at 4 pm and is well staffed. The person working on one of the nights wouid walk around and take orders and then deliver them. They have drinks and sandwiches for reasonable prices. And they provide food until 10pm. The bar and pool is open til 11pm. There was a hot tub and 2 outdoor showers, They provided towels at the pool. There was a nice safe in the room that we used several times, and it worked well. The wifi worked fine. The shuttle to Disney-Epcot was really nice; with air conditioning, and professional, and prompt-don't be late because they do not wait. The price of the room was very reasonable; at $59 and $69 with a senior discount, which is very good for the Orlando area. It is a great hotel for the price, but just be aware it has a few flaws.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ottawasunny
Reviews.Content: We have stayed @ this property 3 times in the last 2 years for pre & post vacation stopovers. We prefer staying onsight during our Disney holidays for various reasons but would highly recommend this hotel for those wanting close proximity to the theme parks but without the high prices. The property is a tranquil oasis amongst the bright lights & traffic along 192 west as it is set back from the road. Kissimmee is not an area we would choose to spent much time in but will always return to this hotel. The rooms are huge & very clean as is the entire property. The complimentary breakfast does the trick (very good coffee!) & the pool area is large & inviting. Many food options are available within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great service, we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Paulin P
Reviews.Content: We did have trouble the first night from one of the rooms but it got taken care of right away. Service was great, Elizabeth and Mario were really helpful and made my family feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great, I enjoyed my time here.”
Reviews.Author: Esmeralda R
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, staff members kept the place looking clean and tidy and definitely went above and beyond to cater to us .. Victoria in particular was fantastic she even helped us out with directions and suggestions as to where we should go on our vacation.. we had an extraordinary experience and we have u guys to thank for only making it better. THANK YOU

Reviews.Title: “3rd year to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: malbie
Reviews.Content: Very well maintained hotel! Plan on staying again. They take care of the rooms and property. Very clean, good breakfast, excellent service!

Reviews.Title: “A great Value with lots of amenities”
Reviews.Author: joyja
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 4 nights while doing Disney. This is a great mid-tier hotel with greats amenities for the average family. We were in a double bedroom on the first floor. The rooms were very clean but had a hint of musty smell. The windows had a blackout drape but no other sheer panels. Anyone walking by and see right into the room so we kept it shut which without natural light in the room, it made it a bit drabby. The safe wasn't working when we check-in and when we called down, maintenance had responded right away. It took him about 4 times and about an hour to fix it and it was fine after that. The hotel provide a great complimentary breakfast each morning. At first, I thought that it was just continental items but they do have a hot items (eggs, sausage and make your own waffel station). If you are going to be having breakfast there, I suggest you get there before 9:30 as they are very prompt breaking it down at 10AM. The dining room was very clean and the staff was very attentive. However, it was rather very busy since everyone took advantage of the the great spread. The hotel also provide a BBQ near the pool area and I saw that many people had went to the local store to buy things so they can cook their own dinner. The room had a microwave and fridge and was a stone throw away from the grocery store and restuarant. They also provide shuttle service to all the parks and the hours were pretty good. I also went in July which was more busy then most months so they may have added more shuttle runs than normal. They also provide free wi-fi but the signal drops constantly so it's not even worth the trouble. Over all - it was a very clean, friendly and great value for families visiting Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel, and especially the manager Ray”
Reviews.Author: cdngirl71Canada
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay while visiting DisneyWorld and the attractions around this area. Shuttles take you back and forth to the parks, and the pool at the hotel kept our girls (9 and 11) very happy. We had wonderful weather in February, which of course helped too! The restaurants around the hotel are wonderful to eat at, really loved the italian one. Also, there is a supermaket within walking distance to do pick up some groceries. Ray was a wonderful contact, remembering us and helping us with our questions. When we come back to WDW, we want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Experience I'd like to forget....”
Reviews.Author: MsJayGee
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 9 nights, (7/13 to 7/22) . For the entire stay, the television was never working. When you have kids that loves the Disney Channel and Nickelodeon, the television needs to be in working order. Maintenance tried to fix the problem, to no avail. The breakfast area is too small and closed in for the number of guests that this hotel can accomodate. There was never enough seating, the lines were too long, and the food areas were not kept clean. The AC in my room was never cold. And last but not least, this hotel charges to print boarding passes and to fax. This stay left me with an experience I'd like to soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “A good location”
Reviews.Author: WestSussexBunny
Reviews.Content: This hotel is pretty much as you'd expect from the brochure descriptions. The breakfast is plentiful, although it did get rather crowded around 9am, so getting a table wasn't always easy. The rooms are spacious and clean, if a little dated now. On the whole the staff were very friendly. We were there for all the attractions that Orlando has to offer and it is a perfect location for that. It is also great if you want to go for a meal and few drinks in the evening and not have to worry about driving, as Old Town is right next door. There are plenty more restaurants only a very short drive away. We had a fantastic holiday and would reccommend the hotel as a great base for Disney and Universal etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent standards and value”
Reviews.Author: Disneyveteran
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 22 nights on our annual trip to Orlando and would recommend it to others. All the communal areas are very smart and fastidiously maintained and the rooms are clean and attractive - no garish comforters on the beds and no mouldy grout in the bathrooms! The bathrooms have been very nicely renovated with black granite surfaces and three mirrored panels above the basin area. The downside is that there is no separate dressing area with a basin outside the bathroom so it's difficult for more than one person to get ready at a time. Instead of a hanging rail, there's a free-standing wardrobe which was a bit too small to accommodate all our clothes. However, in general there's very little to find fault with here. The free breakfast is particularly good and plentiful and the staff are constantly restocking things as they run out. You can even make your own Mickey Mouse waffles which, of course, is a big hit with all the little kids...and my teenage sons and husband! Free coffee and tea are available all day long. My son discovered that he could often get a free newspaper from the reception desk if they had some left over (on-line customers automatically get them free anyway). The staff were obliging and polite almost all the time although Anastacio was unable to help us when we lost our internet connection over the 4th July holiday weekend and said that nothing could be done until everyone came back to work the following Tuesday! Great location and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “clean and friendly - met all our needs”
Reviews.Author: qtmom
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Orlanda for business (Disney Duals Wrestling Tournament) - great experience for the kids (teens of all ages), the coaches and the parents too. Michelle was always a pleasure to talk to at the poolside bar after a long hard day in the gym. Looking forward to our next trip to Disney --- See you soon, Michelle, leave the light on!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the "breakfast room"”
Reviews.Author: Shirley430605
Reviews.Content: The breakfast staff (Ted, Mgr. and Elizabeth) and others worked non-stop cleaning up, replacing foods, and asking guests if they could be of service. This is one of the nicest breakfast rooms I have ever visited. God Bless them. "Service" is the key to having a guest return.

Reviews.Title: “We all enjoyed the facility”
Reviews.Author: trapo1
Reviews.Content: My friends and I met for a night and the staff was very friendly when we first got in. It was pouring that night and they offered to dry our clothes in their dryers. The next morning the breakfast was awesome. We never saw a full breakfast bar like this in a hotel, only pastries, fruit donuts. We were leaving the next day at 4:00 pm for the airport and they let us stay by the pool after we checked out. It started to pour again and we used their restrooms to change and they said we can wait in the lobby until we needed to leave. We will definelty use them again and recommend friends and family as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lilly123070
Reviews.Content: Great stay! Very clean and close to Disney! This hotel made for a great family vacation. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bdubls1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a 4 night stay at the hotel. I found out about it from this website and it looked just like the pictures on here. The hotel was very very clean. Upon check-in, there were 2 young guys working and they were very polite and helpful. As soon as we walked in the room, I mentioned how clean it was and how clean it smelled as well. The room was absolutely spotless. The bathroom was a lot nicer than I expected...shiny black countertops, a huge 3-part mirror and spotless tub/shower. We stayed in the king suite and it had a couch, table, fridge, microwave, safe, TV, etc... Each night we were easily able to park in front our room and the parking lot was well lit and monitored. The breakfast at 7AM was AMAZING. They served pastries, juices, waffles, and a hot item. One morning it was scrambled eggs/sausage...another morning it was ham and cheese omelets.. The breakfast was well worth it. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. You can't beat it for the price. It is very close to all the theme parks. If I had to have a gripe, I would mention that some of the complimentary shuttles leave too late. For example, when we were there, the magic kingdom shuttle left at 10:30AM. The park opens at 9AM and we wanted to get there early, so we ended up driving ourself. I know that is nitpicky, but truly that is the only thing negative I can think of. We never used the pools or spa, but from what I could tell by walking by, they looked clean and lots of people were enjoying them.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend staying here for Good Value Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sharonnewfoundland
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went on a "spur of the moment " trip to Orlando to do some shopping and relaxing in the sun.We were looking for a resonably priced hotel,nothing fancy,but had to be CLEAN.That's just what we found here.The rooms were well maintained and clean.There was a mini fridge,microwave and coffee maker in the room and all were working and in good shape.The breakfast was advertised as continental but there was always some hot breakfast food selection there and the food was good.There is no restaraunt in the hotel but just a short walk across the street has 4 restaraunts and a grocery store.There,s shuttle service to major parks and the staff on the desk were always helpful and friendly.A young man there named Anastacio was especially helpful when ordering food etc.The pool was a nice size but could have used some more frequent cleaning.Our most enjoyable time spent at the Hotel were on the pool deck where the bartender,Michelle,was always a delight.She's there from 4-11 p.m daily when the pool side bar was open for bussiness.She gave us great advise on places to go and how best to get threre.She was efficient at her job as well as always being aware of everything that was going on around the area.Very pleasant lady and an assett to the hotel for sure!I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review”
Reviews.Author: WanderingWebbs1985
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks during the end of May and beginning of June 2011. The grounds are very nice and the room, though simple, was relatively roomy enough. The breakfast was adequate for a free offering. Our major complaints are threefold. First, the lighting in the rooms is terrible. There are too few lights and too low wattage. Secondly, we found the cleanliness of our room really deteriorated over our stay. Our bathroom floor was not swept or mopped for the entire 2 weeks and even the dead bug that appeared on the floor mid-vacation was still there at the end. Our bathroom counter was rarely wiped down and the bathtub not cleaned regularly. Our ice bucket, though obviously used, was not put back or a new liner left. We are very tidy in general and it was not like the staff would have alot to do in a room such as ours and yet it was really sub par. Our last issue was that the walls are very thin and the plumbing very noisy. One morning around 6am we shot out of bed because it sounded like a machine gun was going off in our room only to realize our neighbors had simply turned on their shower. This was a regular problem and not just this one time. I think that if the place were advertised as a 2 star you might think it is pretty great but as a 3 it is definitely on the lowest end of that spectrum. The price we paid per night was really affordable but we'd probably look elsewhere for lodging if we were to travel to the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value !!!”
Reviews.Author: Ocean00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect. The rooms were nice and clean and had a fridge and microwave. My only complaint would be that the room felt quite damp and could use a dehumidifier. The pool area was wonderful, with lots of loungers and tables with umbrellas. The cabana bar was excellent, lots of choice on snacks and drinks and great service.Buffet breakfast was a great way to start the day, lots of variety and well stocked. The location of this hotel was the best, lots of restaurants, grocery store and mini putt all within a 5 minute walk. We also used the shuttle service for shopping and Sea World, which was always on time and friendly service. We bought our Sea World tickets at the hotel, and the lady at the tour desk was very friendly and helpful. With this hotel you can't beat the price and the value, great rooms, pool and breakfast and most of all Location. We can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Amenities, & Staff”
Reviews.Author: WhosUrDaddy12
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with 5 members of my family (including my wife and children, ages 5 & 2). Upon arrival I was greeted very warmly at the front desk by Anastacio, Chris, and Michelle (whom I had read about on several other reviews on this site). The 3 of them made an otherwise frustrating day of travel very positive. They had us checked-in and on our way within minutes. They were truly a pleasure to work with and for that I would certainly recommend this hotel. But there are more positives to go along with that. The location of this hotel is perfect, especially for those who don’t have transportation. There are restaurants, a grocery store, and several other shops well within walking distance. The parking lot connects directly to the lot of a large shopping center. We found this extremely convenient as we made several small purchases throughout our 4-night stay. A couple of the restaurants offer discounts or freebies with room key, which is always nice. We did not take the shuttle, as we had our own transportation, so I can’t comment on that service. However, all the Disney parks are within 15 minutes. The daily continental breakfast is a nice touch to save a few bucks but also very good. There was something for everyone, including the kids, and always more than enough. Although there was a lot of people in there around the same time, it never felt too cramped or crowded. The staff at the breakfast were great as well, keeping items stocked and the tables clear. The pool area and pool bar were a nice touch that we took full advantage of. The area was kept clean and clean towels (although not full size) were readily available anytime. You can’t write a review of this hotel and not mention the pool bartender Michelle. She’s personable and made you feel right at home. Order the Rum Punch (with a “punch”). The rooms were perfect for what we needed. We had 4 adults and 2 small children in one 2 Queen suite and made it work. The fridge, microwave, and sleep sofa were very convenient and came in handy for sure. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who inquired and would say it’s a great value for the family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: dryals
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice & clean, spacious bathroom. We ate in the free breakfast area every morning, the staff kept the food flowing. Location was easy to find and convenient. We stayed at the motel for a day to take a break from the amusements and the pool was beautiful. Towels by the pool for your use. The staff was extemely nice. This was more than we expected and would not hesitate to stay there again. You cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Really basic, clean - ok if on very tight budget. No light in rooms - depressing!”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Happy-Girl
Reviews.Content: Really hated kissimee and would not recommend it as a good place to stay in Orlando, international drive is much more upmarket. The receptionist at this hotel was really surly, we could't open our door and had to go back to reception 3 times before she would sort it out. Room large and VERY clean, but it was really dark, the whole place reminded me of a large council estate with a pool! Breakfast is a nightmare, really cheap food and loads of enormous americians trying to eat as much of everything - really horrid.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Dar1964
Reviews.Content: I'm a big Disney fan and over the years have stayed on Disney value and moderate resorts and in the Kissimmee area. After reading the reviews of this hotel decided to again try off resort, I wasn't disappointed. In fact would book again and return. The hotel is very well maintained. Being smaller in size makes everything so near, no long walks after an exhausting day just to get back to your room. Loads of great shopping, restaurants and a super market just steps away. Rooms are large and equipped with good sized fridge, microwave, coffee maker, couch as well as a table. Cabanna bar by the pool opens at 4 , staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel also offers free breakfast, which can get pretty busy but it's free and there is an endless variety. Buses also run to all parks, for free not just Disney, so that's another bonus. We stayed late at Universal one night to catch a concert return fair was $35, well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: carl7278
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in Florida many times over the years this was the best hotel . The rooms were spotless. The Breakfast buffet was excellent. The staff were by far the best I have ever encountered. Special thanks to Eva, Vashie and Ted. We stayed 3 weeks and it was one of our best holidays ever.

Reviews.Title: “Things missing out of room”
Reviews.Author: nbgirl37
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the hotel overall. Rooms were clean and the food was good. The thing I was very upset over was the day before leaving while my daughter was packing her things she noticed 2 items missing from the room. She had purchased these at Harry Potter and they could not be replaced. I spoke with someone at the front desk and I was told nothing could be done and he was basically laughing at me. Due to this I will not be staying there again when I go back to Florida and would recommend anyone considering staying there to look at other options. Before choosing this hotel I had read the reviews and thought maybe the negative reviews were just people wanting to complain however this is not the first time things have gone missing from rooms as I have read in previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value. Nice Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RhodeTripper
Reviews.Content: We drove down from Rhode Island for April Spring break, along with every other family, apparently, from the entire east coast. And Canada. And England. I've never experienced swarming crowds before of such magnitude as we got at Disney for Easter week. 10 out of 10 on the goofy crowd-o-meter. You think those big white Mickey mits are for waving and high-fiving? They're for pushing more people into the parks! Two hour wait for Toy Story Mania. Really? Lines for toilets. Lines for food. Lines just to get into a line that I had no idea what the line was for! Disgusted looks on faces because god-forbid, some mother had to change course before plowing into my 8-year-old daughter. "But you just ran into my child." "You just ran into MY child!" Ah, the Disney magic. Where dreams are made. Had enough? Then drive very fast to Comfort Suites, where your very own comfortable room awaits, complete with nice big beds that are CLEAN (yes, by housekeepers that --omg--don't speak English as their first language! YIKES! But who smile and are extremely nice and will arrange your ridiculously over-priced Disney buddies nicely on your bed every day and don't take anything like the laptop or cash we had laying around for a week on top of the safe that we could have used in the room). Take a dip in the pool, slurp your margarita you just got from Michelle, and yell at your kids to not splash any poor uptight parents too scared of tiny little lizards that you may happen to see before you blink. I think we saved over $1000 staying at this hotel rather than at entitlement central over at the Value Resorts, and the rooms were twice as big, and the staff went out of their way to make you feel righteous. Yes, it's not fresh off the hotel factory. It's older. Not old. Older. They do a great job with colors. The grounds are beautiful. Our furniture was not dated in the least. Yes, it is a motel-style hotel with outside doors and shared balconies, but the soundproffing is actually better with the heavy outside doors. Yes, the square pillows were a pain, but you get lots of them. Too many, in fact. Yes, the rug always felt wet, and you had to run the hot water for 5 mins before the water got hot enough to shower if you got up before dawn for rope-drops. But, honestly? We paid $700 for Easter week. It was a great, wonderful value of a hotel stay for the money we paid. And the best was the shopping plaza and restaurants next door. Cracker Barrel, Carrabbas, Subway, Chinese, Sushi. Shall I go on? Or would you rather eat yet another pulled pork Mickey sandwich? It's hard enough to swim against the schools of frenzied Disney-maniacs during the day. You don't have to do it at night, too, brother! Clean. Safe and comfy, with palm trees and Mickey waffles. Our great sanctuary from THE WORLD. Our great value. We loved our stay with you, Comfort Suites Maingate!

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience here ;(”
Reviews.Author: scatt59
Reviews.Content: we were put in this hotel in error by our travel agent..supposed to be staying at the "comfort suites maingate east" but realized just b4 leaving she made reservations at the wrong hotel..i said since both were comfort suites we would give it a shot, the travel agency said if we were not happy here they would pay for us to move..the room was kinda grungy, my son couldn't sleep on the really old pullout couch (which was not made up for us btw) the next day we tried another room but it was just the same if not worse than the first one so we decided to check out after 1 day and go to the original hotel...boy was i glad we made that change, the beds were comfortable, rooms were clean..exact opposite of this place..i will never stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: GardnerSK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights. April 11th, 2011 through April 15th. We payed $89/night except for Friday night which was $99. We wanted a cheaper hotel as this was the second half of our Florida stay. The first half being on the ocean. We were doing Disney and Sea World- so we would only be here to shower and sleep. The furnishing in this room were cheap to say the least. Everything was completely outdated- nothing worked right. The beds were tiny- and very uncomfortable. The pillows were little squares, not a pillow. The walls are paper thin- you could hear everything. Housekeeping was very sketchy- and didn't speak English. I chose not to have housekeeping and clean myself, because I was so nervous about them. Even with the do not disturb sign on the door- they still peeked throw the window, and knocked on the door. You have to sign a paper if you choose not to have housekeeping everyday. There are so many hotels in this area- you can find better for the same price. I never felt safe in this hotel. The pool was very nice looking, we only used it one day, and 3 of us were sick within 3 days after. I honestly do not know if that was from the pool or something else though. I never saw the hot tub- this could have been just me, because we weren't there enough. Room did not look like pictures. Sorry, to be so negative but this place was horrible! We will never stay here again. Oh and there were lizards everywhere. I do realize these are normal in Florida, but seriously, we have stayed at other hotels in Florida and they were not half this bad. These lizards run everywhere in the hallways.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: michel182154
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there for a week, nothing negative to tell about this place, everything was perfect. Clean, nice rooms, very nice pool with a pool bar. The bar tender "Michelle" was great, makes good drinks.

Reviews.Title: “A great deal and a nice stay!”
Reviews.Author: rtgirl77
Reviews.Content: ABOUT US: We are native floridians who have disney passes and have stayed in many places in the Orlando area, including Disney properties. I'm somewhat of a room snob and won't stay anywhere that isn't clean, safe and in a preferred location.We traveled with myself, my husband, our 12 yr old daughter, our 11 year old son and our two toddler daughters, 20 months and 30 months. OVERALL: The service at this resort was great. I got an email prior to arriving from the GM letting us know that he had upgraded us to a pool front room because our booked category wasn't available for our stay. We were very appreciative of both his communication with us and the upgrade. The staff was friendly and helpful and we got a survey by email after the stay which said to me that they care about improving. We were booked into a queen with 2 queen beds and a pull out queen sofa bed. ROOM: Clean with comfortable bedding but slightly small for the number of beds. Even so, it had a microwave and mini fridge and was well equipped for our stay. BREAKFAST The free breakfast was good, complete with mickey waffles for the kids, yogurt, cereal, assorted breads and a hot item or two like bacon or sausage. COMMON AREAS Pool was clean but kiddie pool looked warn and a bit dirty. Lobby and breakfast room were clean but the breakfast area was very small and always quite crowded. The lines to get food, especially waffles were very long. There was adequate seating and most days, we ended up taking the food back to our room where there really wasn't sufficient room there either. The whole stay was very pleasant and we feel we got an excellent value. I would definitely recommend if you want an inexpensive, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice motel in the Heart of Florida.”
Reviews.Author: dm8711
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and it was very pleasant. Our room was clean and everything worked great. Not the most spacious suites, but they did the trick. Very nice pool area. Pool was very warm, and the Hot Tub was hot as it should be. Nice little kiddie pool with a fountain. (Not Heated). Nice little pool bar that is open evenings. Very nice tropically landscaped grounds. The motel is set back off Irlo Bronson Blvd, so it seems secluded. No traffic noises to worry about. The breakfast area was well stocked, tasty, and had different hot items every day. The staff was right on top of things also. If I have one complaint it would be that the breakfast area was congested, and very busy. Too many tables in too small of a room. Lines wound around the tables, and there was no space to move around. People were taking food to the pool area to find seating also. The lines were long and confusing. People waiting to make waffles were in the same line as people waiting to get hot items. A couple of tables need to be moved to the lobby area, and on busy days the hours should be extended. Saw a little tension among customers over the moving of chairs from table to table through the week. One little added plus....NO CHARGE for the ROOM SAFE ! That was a pleasant surprise! All in all we really enjoyed our stay, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janpk
Reviews.Content: Overall a pleasant experience. Rooms clean and well-maintained, staff pleasant and friendly. Pool area clean - poolside bar great after a day of walking Disney. If hanging out at a hotel is part of your vacation not a lot of extra amenities but for those who will be out doing the Disney/Universal experiences - perfect. Good restaurants/shops nearby. Price good. Continental breakfast beyond expectations - Mickey waffles - thumbs up! Could use more flexible shuttle times to the parks - especially Universal - only one pickup and always packed. Had the 2 queens and sofa bed - perfect for a family of 4+.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty spartan”
Reviews.Author: MaBiobabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night following at day at WDW. We chose the hotel for its location. The furnishings were the cheapest i have seen in a hotel in a long time. The pillows were small, square and uncomfortable. Not much sound-proofing. You could hear every flush and shower. I don't know why but I had no desire to take a shower in the room. It looked clean but... Breakfast was good and we were able to take our food outside to the pool. Though we didn't use it, the pool area looked nice. It was pretty big. I don't think I will stay there again. I think I can do better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in customer service”
Reviews.Author: dbtraveller_11
Reviews.Content: Michelle the bartender was great.....friendly, super personality for the position and she made our stay all the more fun. But, on our last day when I noticed some souvenirs from Daytona Beach missing, the front desk staff and manager told me there was nothing they could do but call the sheriff. The manager told me it must be my fault they were missing because he knows the maid would not have done it. These items were not removed from the room after purchase so I know something happened during room servicing. Poor service by front desk staff especially when I was leaving and didn't have time to call the sheriff.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DebbieinTN
Reviews.Content: Booked online direct with prepayment (2 rooms) saved over senior and AAA pricing. Breakfast was fine, waffles were very good remainder was better than typical. We were upgraded to poolside which was nice. Rooms were very large (2 queen beds with sleeper sofa) only problem they have no printed tv guide (oh well). Only issue, we were going to purchase Disney tickets at hotel. If we didn't know in advance how much ticket should have been we were being charged $5 addtl for convenience (per ticket with 7 attending) Buy your tickets at gate was no wait at all. The pool, kiddie pool and hot tub were clean and had plenty of lounges and table/chairs.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites live up to their name”
Reviews.Author: cady3312
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and roomy, nice hot breakfast every morning, large pool with a pool-side bar. The staff was helpful, especially Michelle. We met Michelle at the pool-side bar and she was very friendly and helpful with information on where to eat and places to go. Would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, affordable and eager-to-please staff”
Reviews.Author: Frostyjenny
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived at our room. Very spacious (two children, two moms) and lots of room for our bags. The fridge worked well and microwave came in handy for popcorn snack and re-heating leftovers. No cutlery or dishes in the room. Having a few plates in the room that are microwavable would have been helpful. The pool is just as pictured... nice and warm... great for kids and plenty of chairs for everyone. Nice hot tub, too! Oh, and can't forget to mention the cabana bar and Michelle! I have to say that the staff work really hard to keep this facility clean. Always working on the grounds and exterior of the building. Very accommodating to our requests, too. The breakfast buffet is pretty basic, but suffices to fill you up before heading out for the day. The kids loved the mickey-shaped waffles. My friend and the kids didn't enjoy the eggs (especially the hard boiled eggs, yuck). Lots of fruit, yogurt and very good coffee. Definitely need more than one toaster and perhaps a low-calorie cereal option. Teddy and his team did a great job! Thank you! Only downside was the a/c unit in the room. It's rather loud, especially loud for the one on the pullout sofa. We used the couch cushions to deflect the airflow and insulate the loudness of the unit. This hotel is great for those on a budget and for families. It served its purpose and we especially enjoyed the pool! Would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jalyfle
Reviews.Content: an older hotel, would only stay there again if I were tight on money . . . the continental breakfast was about the only decent thing. lobby doors are locked after midnite, had to wait for quite a while for the desk person to unlock the door for me to get in (he was checking in a few people) room was less than desireable. had 5 baby mosquitos in the bathroom, toilet seat broke, water stain on carpet by heating/airconditioning unit, also water stain on bottom of sleep sofa. no strong smell of mold or anything else from the stain though. bed was comfortable. gaps under door should really be plugged to keep critters out. older giant tv. walls a little thin, heard kids and families in rooms on both sides of our room, and outside early in the morning. seating capacity in dining area was not able to accomodate all the people partaking of the free breakfast over the weekend. people were sitting in the lobby eating, and outside at the 4 tables in the patio area. pool looked nice, wasn't able to enjoy it. this hotel really needs an update.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, accommodating, clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: shelby013
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel and found everyone on staff quite helpful, just had to ask . Front desk staff were very accommodating. Rooms were clean, breakfast was busy but if you were up early as we were to catch the complimentary bus to Disney, Universal and Seaworld we had no problems being on time. Michelle at the bar is very nice and knowledgeable about what to do and see, pat on the back for her, deserves tips! She works as bartender/cook (the motel has a small menu at the pool bar after 4pm) and still service with a smile! My only suggestion would be to get a new computer with updated browsers so clients staying at this hotel can easily print off their boarding passes before they leave for the airport as a convenience. 15 minutes of internet use per day is included but I had to go elsewhere to print off boarding passes. (I didn't want the hassle of dealing with that airport as I had a small child with me). Overall, a great vacation spot. My daughter loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service and no hot water for two days. Travel Agent”
Reviews.Author: trip12345_11
Reviews.Content: Worst service and no hot water for two days . Front office staff very rude. Signed TRAVEL AGENT

Reviews.Title: “WOW ....WHAT A PLACE”
Reviews.Author: DINALDO
Reviews.Content: At the Comfort Suites, we had a FABULOUS experience. The room are very clean, comfortable, relaxing and very well maintained. The complimentary breakfast each day was an added bonus. Not to mention it was very tasty and different every day. The staff is very kind, considerate, friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. PLEASE GO AND HAVE FUN AT THE COMFORT SUITES ......

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money as we were 5 people, including warm breakfast with waffles”
Reviews.Author: Absaharry
Reviews.Content: We really just slept there and had breakfast and the rates were great for 5 people sharing a double room. Waffle maker was excellent and we enjoyed making waffles every morning. Wireless internet in our room was great. Fridge and microwave in room was convenient. Overall location was nice and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CAB_58_11
Reviews.Content: Great value for money. Consistent quality of breakfast and service. Comfortable beds. Large room with microwave and fridge, couch and table. Transport to attractions on time but very rigid time schedule with 5 trips to resorts in morning and no pickups til later afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “A nice suprise”
Reviews.Author: zamie22922
