Reviews.Content: my husband and i planned a disney vacation with our 3 children (4,6,3 months) we had gotten a vacation home to rent for the week...when we showed up at it we opend the door and a HUGE spider litterally jumped inside and what had to have been 1000 or more babies jumped off the spider to make the story short since the review isnt about the home... we decided after seeing roaches and more spiders everywhere that there was definatly an infestation and left the home... we started driving freaking out about where we are gonna go ( @ 10pm and 23hrs from home!) i drove past a place far off the main road looked nice thought we would give it a try at least for the night. we got to our room and it smelled nice looked clean had a fridge and microwave. we woke up in the morning refreshed it was a quiet night. we went to the free breakfast they offer and it was GREAT. the food is nothing spectacular but way better then most free breakfasts. we ended up staying there the entire length of our trip we used the washer and dryers in the hotel which were clean and good and the wifi worked great. the bar was amazing the pool stays open late and nobody is out there at night almost every night we were able to take the baby and the kids to swim late and have some drinks i LOVE this hotel we are returning a week for a 2 week stay!

Reviews.Title: “AN AWSOME STAY”
Reviews.Author: burnitec
Reviews.Content: this was our second stay at the comfort suites.the rooms were clean and fresh.the rooms were ready upon arrival.the breakfast was awsome the food was hot and great. upon check out the two clerks ted and andre were awsome they made you feel important. thank-you

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: asander
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at this hotel, and will be going back again at some point this year. The rooms are spacious and clean, staff is kind and helpful, the large and kiddie pool are both maintained very well. The hotel is located in a safe area, close to the parks, and with direct access to a strip mall with restaurants, grocery store, puttputt golf, etc. The morning breakfast is the best free breakfast I have seen in a hotel and my son loves the mickey waffles (ok, I do too if I'm being honest!). We always stop into the souvenir store for a treat before we leave, in fact I get all my Disney coffee mugs there, as they are a few dollars cheaper than Disney. Can't recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: god2luv
Reviews.Content: At the Comfort Suites, my family and I had a truly FABULOUS experience and stay. The room was very clean, comfortable, relaxing and overall well maintained. The complimentary breakfast each day was an added bonus. Not to mention it was very tasty. The staff were very kind, considerate, friendly, knowledgeable, and professional. The location to the theme parks we visited while their (Disney World and Universal Studios) was simply AWESOME. We were only 2 miles away. The Comfort Suites is generously located by tourist attractions and many fine eating spots. They even have free parking, nice size pool, free internet, and workout room. If you're looking for a peaceful, clean, well maintained, and kind staff of professionals, this is the place for you. I'd recommend it without any reservation. Thanks Comfort Suites for a noteworthy stay.

Reviews.Title: “Now our favorite place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyRunner11
Reviews.Content: From the front desk to housekeeping to the breakfast staff...the customer service was great! Everyone we met on the staff was friendly and really cared that we were enjoying our stay. The free, hot breakfast was very much appreciated. The rooms were large and comfortable. Nice heated pool and jacuzzi. But it was the location that made the trip perfect....how nice to be able to walk to great restaurants like Carabbas, Cracker Barrel, Fridays, great local pizza and Chinese restaurants, grocery stores and even putt-putt golf! Disney is only 4 miles away too and the hotel offers free shuttle service if you don't feel like driving.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancysimon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from Dec 22 2010 to Dec 26 2010. Friendly staff . . Has a pool bar which is comforting and relaxing . The worker we had was Michelle. Fabulous person very friendly and helpful. the rooms are great . Very spacious and very cleaned. They provide a great Buffet breakfast that was always fabulous. All the staff are amazing. Family friendly. I stayed here with my family and we all loved it and had a good time. i would recommend this hotel and would stay here again Nancy & Roger

Reviews.Title: “spacious & sparkling”
Reviews.Author: goposmom
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights at one of Disney's most elegant resorts, I was braced for my night at an "ordinary" hotel. But this is no "ordinary" hotel. The desk staff was gracious and anticipated our every need. The rooms were spacious and sparkling. The breakfast buffet was varied and delicious. I can't say enough about how well maintained and well staffed this property is...no superlative would be an overstatement!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised, and very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: OttawaRon045
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel (price = $59 per night) not expecting much but were surprised at how friendly the staff were and clean the room was. Since it was only noon on the day we were to check in, it was surprising that they had a room available since the previous night they were sold out but the cleaning staff was litterally running to clean up. The front desk was down to earth and helpful, the premises were clean and you receive a 2 for 1 drink coupon upon checkin, along with a complimentary breakfast which included bacon and eggs and waffles, it was more than satisfactory. I find it unfortunate that some people do have a not so great stay and there are others who compare their stay to all hotels. This is a no nonsense hotel, no breakfast in bed, no roomservice, nothing but decent hardworking people who are willing to go out of their way to please you if you gave them half a chance. For the price, the value was far exceeding higher priced hotels. I do not that they had a clean hotel, free wireless (most more expensive hotels charge for wireless), free light breakfast (again the more expensive charge for this), 2 for 1 drinks at the poolside bar and friendly staff with great attitudes and to top it off a clean comfortable room. More expensive hotels may offer more but it comes at a price and nothing is free. If I were to say it is value for the money, that would be an understatement. Excellent hotel/motel for this canadian traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveKimP
Reviews.Content: Stayed there at the beginning of my 15 day vacation in Florida for two days and came back on the final day before leaving Fla. Clean rooms, awesome breakfast and huge swimming pool. Restraunts close by to walk to as well a grocery store and liquor store that is within easy walking distance. My three teenage children enjoyed the pool as mom and me had a couple drinks at the pool side bar during Happy Hour. Cannot wait to visit it again next year.

Reviews.Title: “My first stop when arriving at Disney.”
Reviews.Author: gnostictom
Reviews.Content: Very close to entrance to Disney World, clean pool and hottub, comfortable beds, good breakfast, rooms available in advance of official check-in time, clean laundry, nice landscaping, close to restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Great, family friendly hotel with helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: vickimarneh
Reviews.Content: Very close to Disney Parks. Restaurants right there too. Hotel was in a nice location, very clean, friendly staff ... would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and wonderful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Zalarians
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with friends because we were going to be at Disney all day. The staff was very accommodating and helpful. Great rooms & beds. Breakfast the next day was much better than we expected. Attendants were busy making sure everything was hot and constantly replenished. Only downside I could say about the hotel was the shuttle - not enough runs to the parks. We missed their one pick-up in the evening @ Disney and had to take a cab back but other than that, a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, close to Disney attractions”
Reviews.Author: djbucc
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying in this hotel during our stay for AAU cross country meet. Hotel was close to all areas we needed to get to, complimentary continental breakfast which included mickey waffles. Walking distance to restaraunts. When we visited, it was cool, and got very cold @ night, the kids still enjoyed swimming and I have to say, Michelle at the Cabana bar was awesome. She pulled out propane heaters for us and always had a cold drink and smile waiting for us. Looking forward to a visit next year, hopefully if we make it!!

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: HuskieMom
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Maingate. Michelle at the Cabana bar was very attentive and friendly - loved the strawberry/mango margaritas!! Thanks Michelle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay thanks to Mekos at the Front Desk.”
Reviews.Author: popusa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are seasoned travelers and typically, aren't stressed even when traveling with our 9 mos. old twins and 4 year old, but this trip was exceptionally rough. We were originally booked into the Gaylord, but they screwed up our reservation. We ended up at the Comfort Suites because of the proximity to Disney. I trudged into the Comfort Suites not expecting much and tired. I was greeted by Mekos on arrival with sincerity and professionalism. He was genuine and was as good at anticipating guest needs as any staff at a 4 or even 5 star property minus the pretentiousness. It was refreshing and changed my attitude for the better. We needed additional crib sheets and a remote for the TV. when I called the desk he arranged for 2 new sets of bedding that were delivered in less than 5 minutes. The associate that delivered the sheets and the remote was courteous and even asked if he could help us with anything. Definitely unexpected and much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Yoy can't find a better place for the price in Kissimmee. Had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Marshall75650
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out everything was super. We were there Thanksgiving week (stayed four days) with three teenage granddaughter and had connecting rooms overlooking the pool on second floor. Rooms are roomy and beds are comforatble. Housekeeping did an excellent job. The girls loved the pool and hot tub. Morning breakfasts were very good havng waffles, eggs, breakfast meats, fruit, pastries, jucices, milk and coffee. The breakfast room staff made sure that the food was always available and that the tables and room were clean. The gounds around the hotel were neat and clean. The staff was very helpful in answering any questions that we had. Free shuttle to the theme parks to and fro. I must make special mention of Vashtie at the front desk. She is an assett to this hotel. I hope that the management recognizes her outstanding service and compensates her accordingly. When were in the area this will be our number one choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a great price”
Reviews.Author: kldente
Reviews.Content: Suite was clean, easily accessible to all attractions like Disney, Kennedy Space Center, Seaworld and Universal. Highly recommend for family with young children and teenagers. Many restaurants around the the hotel was highly convenient also! Definitely going back next year instead of staying inside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay, great service & close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFun2
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, friendly and overall a very nice place to stay. Michelle the bartender was very fun, we enjoyed visiting with her. The hotel was convienent to all major theme parks and very easy to find your way around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tikitravel06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Comfort Suites along 192. I was a little concerned after reading some of the reviews, however, the accommodations were quite good. If you are looking for a luxury hotel, this is not the place to stay. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the bathroom is a good size. The microwave and mini fridge were convenient. What made our stay a cut above was the staff, particularly Michelle at the poolside bar. She was absolutly amazing, very friendly, courteous, efficient and most of all entertaining. I hope she is still there next time we visit Orlando.. Kin, at the information is desk is also a delight to deal with. She really goes out of her way to ensure you are informed and offers you tips on how to get the most out of your stay. The complimentary breakfast was average and somewhat repetative, yet still a great way to start off your day and save a litle cash. The location of this hotel is perfect if you are visiting the parks, less than a ten minute drive to all four Disney parks. All in all, we enjoyed our stay and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and location”
Reviews.Author: lauraanddave2010
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at the hotel and it is overall a great experience. The breakfast was one of the highlights and also the staff at the Tiki Bar. Michelle, the server at the bar was friendly and a highlight of our trip. She gave us great advice on where to golf and made us whatever drink request we wanted. The location was amazing, with a grocery store and restaurants within walking distance and a short drive to the Magic Kingdom. I would recommend getting a pool view room.

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: michiganbeachflower
Reviews.Content: The rooms had been updated nicely but smelled of stale fragrances VERY strongly (they said they Febreeze after every stay). I have a fragrance allergy and coughed and sneezed all night. Their solution to the problem was to turn the AC on high and let it run. The shuttle to Disney ran very infrequently. The pool was lovely to look at but very cold (supposedly heated). We tried to buy food about 8:30 pm at the pool bar but they were out of about everything except microwaved sandwiches. I definitely would not recommend eating at the pool bar. Breakfast was "okay". The staff was very friendly and accommodating and the reservation agent was very knowledgeable and friendly. Booked a poolside room 3rd floor to see fireworks (per reviews) but could see none.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great....especially Samantha!”
Reviews.Author: Tammy1002301
Reviews.Content: All of the staff was very nice. Both Mekos and Samantha were great. Samantha was super friendly. I really enjoyed her conversations each evening since I was traveling alone. Great employee! Mekos was very friendly too.

Reviews.Title: “great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: derf63
Reviews.Content: We were here for Disney with our kids and were pleasantly surprised by how quiet this hotel is!! The location is great and right next door to a grocery store and several restaurants. Our kids swam many hours in the pool and it was nice and relaxing for all of us. The service was excellent and we have to thank Michelle for the great mango drinks!! She was very helpful and came and took our drink orders while we relaxed by the pool. We will definitely stay here again if we revisit Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisHOkotoks
Reviews.Content: Outstanding service from the time of booking, to the front desk staff who are super helpful, to the housekeeping staff who attended to our room daily and did a great job and the great free breakfast daily. This is our 3rd visit to Orlando/Kissimmee and have only stayed at this hotel. We are returning in the near future, and would not think of staying anywhere else !!

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: mzbuttons
Reviews.Content: I was taking my mom and aunt on a surprise trip to Epcot for the International Food and Wine Festival. Having paid for 3 Disney tickets and knowing that I would be spending money on food in the park coupled with having to rent a car for the trip I was looking for a decent hotel to cut my costs on this trip. Well, after the first night I wanted to move to another hotel but my mom and my aunt, both over 50, refused to pack up and leave. I won't say the hotel was terrible just everything about it screamed BUDGET!! Free Breakfast: I truly believe that all mid priced hotels should offer complimentary hot breakfast and the great reviews on the morning breakfast I found on Tripadvisor were the main reason why I chose this hotel. Do NOT be fooled; the breakfast was sorry! No real eggs, nasty looking sausage and gravy, sandwich meat ham warmed over. Of course they had the staple waffle iron but that's the norm these days. I guess I'm used to the complimentary breakfast at Embassy Suites or Wingate, because I was sorely disappointed here. Room: I HATED the rooms here. They are NOT suites they are regular sized budget hotel rooms with a couch added so they can be called a suite. There is not even a real closet in the rooms. The shower was insanely loud which actually became a joke with my mom and aunt and the air conditioner was really loud. I'm from a family of snorers so I had no problem with sleeping with the loud air conditioner but it was aggravating while I was awake. Further the room had a musty smell. We were not on the side with the pool and none of us used the pool since we were there to eat, but the smell had to have been in the carpet. Also the rooms are all accessible from the outside not a hallway. Meaning you don't walk into a building, through a hallway to get to your room. You park in front of your door and walk into your room. I never think that this is safe, and hate hotels like this because they are really just motels. The Good: I paid $59 a night INCLUDING tax for the room so I feel as though I shouldn't complain too much (though I still would have moved). The lady setting up the breakfast and keeping it stocked was super nice and efficient. The wifi was PERFECT!! Always available, quick, strong signal, easy to access. All of the service staff was really quick and efficient. Our safe wasn't open when we got there; the guy came and fixed it in 5 minutes flat. We always needed extra towels sets and got them very quickly after calling. Overall: I normally LOVE the places I stay and write great reviews on Tripadvisor but I felt like the reviews for this hotel were off. This is like a Motel 6, do NOT confuse it with other Comfort Suites that are in the Wingate/Embassy Suite category. I would NOT ever stay here again and would not advise anyone else to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the nicest bartender in florida”
Reviews.Author: sunnycanoe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week and we enjoyed the beautiful pool and the nice clean rooms. The best part was the nice employees especially Michelle who ran the tiki bar in hotel. She was able to help us navigate around town and give us helpfull hints, I looked forward to seeing her when the bar opened at 4. She truley went out of her way to make our stay memorable....will stay here again. She treated us like family...

Reviews.Title: “Very good friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Michael1024
Reviews.Content: I'd like to thank Comfort Suites for a wonderful stay and I'd also like to thank the friendly Bartender Michelle for her excellent customer service and friendly conversations which she had with us at poolside. I will be booking my next stay in Orlando with Comfort Suites again.

Reviews.Title: “Why I would stay at Comfort Suites AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: CristyKing
Reviews.Content: The rooms were exactly what I expected on the inside from a large hotel chain.Basically you've seen one you've seen them all.What i didn't expect was how quiet and comfortable the room was.It felt great to be able to shut the door and hear nothing after a day at the theme parks with three young kids.But the most unexpected thing was the service.The service I felt was not indicitive of a large hotel chain but a quaint bed and breakfast.The staff were all above average in my opinion.One however made our whole vacation worth staying at Comfort Suites,Michelle Seebech,she was the bartender at the poolside cabana.More than a bartender she was a combination of a friend,therapist,and comedian a real person in the land of make-believe.I only wish i had more money to tip her because i know she doesnt get paid what she's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites Maingate is a comfortable, clean hotel at a good value.”
Reviews.Author: gayle2010
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate, all employees were pleasant and helpful especially Michelle at the Tiki Cabana. I spent a couple days out there with her relaxing by the pool, I didn't even have to go to the bar MIchelle was always constantly checking to see if anyone needed anything. Over all is was a very relaxing and pleasant stay. I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service from all employees”
Reviews.Author: jshaffner216
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and close to the attractions in Orlando. The employees were friendly and professional. Michelle, the poolside bartender was terrific. She was friendly, professional, and very attentive to our needs. We would definately reccommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite first-night hotel for Disney”
Reviews.Author: cjbnc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Disney World 1-3 times every year, and stay on property using our timeshare points. We usually arrive the night before our reservation and stay at a nice local hotel the first night to save points. The Comfort Suites Maingate is our nice hotel of choice in the area. We've stayed here a half dozen times or so. The room is always clean, ready on time, easy to access, easy to park. The hotel is located just off a strip mall with a Winn Dixie Marketplace which is a great place to stop from bottled water and snacks before checking in to our main hotel for the week. For that matter, the CS Maingate has minifridges in the rooms so you could keep snacks there too.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: bahamamama242
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk was very helpful always with a smile excellent guess service would love to visit again...hight five to mekos....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Scarpetta1234
Reviews.Content: Just finished recovering from vacationing. I spent hours scouring Trip Advisor for information and it heavily influenced not only my choice of where to stay on our vacation but also what to do while there, and I wanted EVERYONE to know that we had a wonderful time! I was very concerned about choosing a good hotel (nothing fancy yet still clean and comfortable) and, thanks to all of the detailed reviews posted here, we found the right one. Check-in was a breeze. Ted, the wonderful gentleman that checked us in was beyond friendly and accomodating! He upgraded us a pool facing room which allowed us to view the nightly fireworks show over Disney. We were so ticked with that one small gesture! On subsequent days he always greeted us and asked how our trip was going, all the while completing his tasks at hand. Ted is the prime example of how customers should be handled. Hope he is "on his way up"! Rooms were clean and comfortable. Housekeeping did a fabulous job. Breakfast was never overly-crowded (we ate early, ususally by 8am) and there was always plenty to eat. It was nice that the hot food items were rotated out on a daily basis. Mario in the dining area efficiently went about ensuring that everything was stocked and always had a warm smile. Be sure to say "Good Morning" to him! The pool is very important to us when we go on vacation because we do not have one and my son should have been born a fish! I was a little worried about the pool when I read that it was only 4' deep. Should not have worried..turns out that it is a little less than 5' deep but still perfect ! Great place to relax after long days at the parks. Grocery store is right next door. Great place to grab something to put in the fridge and heat up in the microwave. Thanks to all of the hotel staff and also to everyone who posts reviews here. It is great to have real world reviews to help base your decisions on. P.S. Go to the SAK Comedy Club (A MUST---we laughed so hard, a highlight of our trip--ranked higher than the Wizerding World for my 17 and 20 year old and they LOVE Harry Potter!!) and also to the Harry P. Leu Gardens. Both made for great family outings on days in between the big parks that didn't cost a fortune!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A lot of amenities for at a great rate”
Reviews.Author: donaldan
Reviews.Content: Great location, with good restaurants and shopping within short walk. Large room, all with additional pull out sofa bed. Spacious bathroom with long granite counter, hair dryer, mirror galore. Dual phone, multi channel TV, refrigerator, microwave oven, coffee maker, in-room safety lock box, ironing board. Very quiet A/C. Couldn't ask for more at very compeitive rate. The breakfast room is well equippped with a lot of food choices, great for family to save money on. Nice pool complex. Within the Formosa Gardens complex where the hotel is, are Market Place grocery store, Cracker Barrel, Carrabba's, TGI Friday, Giordano's Pizzaria, Outback Steak House, Red Lobster, Japanese Sushi, Taste of China and Sub Way. Very casual and cheerful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Smash42
Reviews.Content: OK so I checked in around 6 pm. Room was amazing except the toilet was not flushing. I called down to the desk and let them know. I told them we (my GF and I) were going out to dinner to the restaurants nearby and if they could come then, it would be awesome. Not only did they come and fix the toilet but they left 2 bags of chocolate chip milanos on the coffee table along with a note saying "sorry for the inconvenience". I was not expecting that at all. The pool was good but not deep at all. Not a big deal. The shuttle service to the parks are limited and fill up quickly. Unfortunately, we missed ours on the way back. We called the hotel to see if they can send the shuttle again but said no. However, they said that they would call us a cab and refund us half our cab bill. That was good enough for me. The breakfast was good and they let us take items out of the breakfast area. Overall good service, nice room and pleasant stay. I would go again but too far from home and not going to go to disney world until a while.

Reviews.Title: “8 night Disneyworld trip an Incrediblely planned Bargain. Job well done!”
Reviews.Author: pauldreese
Reviews.Content: Our family w/ 4 kids + 7 suitcases accomodated comfortably. Suites R 4-5 minutes 2 Majic Kingdom. Quality Queen Pilowtops. True Smoke free facility. Room Carpet N Furniture is current. We stocked the in-room refridge w beverages. (DISNEY allows ALL food and beverages to walk into the park.) (EXC NO beer or glass.) We took a case of waters, Chips, Candy, Apples, ETC. into parks each day. Target Superstore + Grocery 1 mile from Suites. We bot laundry soap @ TGT and rewashed our clothes. {The free hotel shuttle service, NOT convenient times. Only twice each way.. per park. (Home at 5P and 1130P) } The pool is only 4.5 deep, BUT is very large. Superior pool courtyard landscaping. Nice variety of palm and tropical specimens. Lobby area large and FRIENDLY and ACCOMODATING. They are determined to stay afloat against DISNEY lodging offers. Property is being maintainced regularly... The poolgate is opened at 7am, (Only they have not yet skimmed the beetles out by that time.) Pool closes strictly at 11P... Pool area has kiddy baby mushroom fountain pool, and oversized hot tub for adults at 100 degrees. Spa.. is Hot, muscle relaxing, but not a vigourous bubble supply. Pool and spa water quality maintained well. THEIR, Hot Breakfast Works. They have free 24 hour coffee station with Arabica coffee. I used it allot, early and late. Breakfast has scrambled eggs and cheese with sausage links. 4 variety of cold cereals, flavored Yogurt, apples and banannas, toast and english muffins and bagels and hot waffles. The Orange Juice machine quality is awesome. I drank 40 oz every morning to hydrate. Filtered water and apple juice. Breakfast opens at 7am, Every table fills quickly and cycles... You can take brkfast out to pool courtyard or room... They don't grimace at you. My typical lodging is Embassy Suites, but when I chose to cut my lodging bill IN HALF, I found that this choice was wonderful and a GREAT VALUE. I recommend this lodging.. You will definately be getting your moneys worth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Xenajo
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in, late at night, we were a little skeptical as the clerk was not dress nicely. The next day, was better. The room was clean and nice. When we asked for extra towels as we had 5 in our family, within a couple of minutes, we received the towels. The pool and hot tub were cleaned and not dirty. Very warm. The breakfast area was kept cleaned. The only complaint was that when there was alot of people, it wa crammed. There was not a limit on how many waffles you can make and some of the people where making 3-5 at one time. This was a little annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as last time we stayed...”
Reviews.Author: boomer4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in 2006, and we returned because we really enjoyed the hotel. In 2006 the hotel had just been renovated and was like new. Obviously hotels at Disney World get a lot of wear and tear. This hotel was definitely more run down than it was four years ago. They also are having problems with humidity levels in the rooms. There is a sign posted to leave your air conditioner at a certain temperature. The rooms just do not get very cool, and feel damp and very humid. I'm sure this is a continual problem in Florida, but the other hotels we stayed at on this vacation were cool with low humidity. This hotel was o.k., but I wasn't as impressed as I was on our last visit. I think next time we'll stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Inn Suites was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: amyjo7475
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn Suites Maingate in Kissimee for our first family vacation to Florida. We were very pleased with our room, the convient location, accomadations and most of all the staff. They were all very helpful and made our stay that much more enjoyable. Our kids enjoyed the Mickey Mouse waffles each and every morning before we hit the parks. We would pick to stay here each and every time when we visit Florida. Thanks for showing us great hospitality!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful.......”
Reviews.Author: msglo38
Reviews.Content: A group of us stayed here on 6-26-10 it was so amazing the rooms were awesome . The service was wonderful. The breakfast was good. The rooms were very clean the smell was awesome. You can tell they really keep this hotel up there was nothing to complain about because it was so wonderful were planning on coming back here again and again and again because this place is so beautiful. You keep up the good work comfortsuites if you complained about this hotel well there something wrong......

Reviews.Title: “needed more”
Reviews.Author: hilltoptraveler
Reviews.Content: Nice average hotel with average pool with average breakfast, except for the eggs. Went for vacation feeling good about staying at a Comfort Suites. After arriving there our room smelled musty, maybe not being used for a length of time. Complementary travel to and from Disney was very limited, with some bus connections before getting where we wanted to be. Just expecting a little more out of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Scrapper_gina
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our three children ages 10, 5 and 4, the pool was great, the pool bar was my husbands favourite place, the kids were thrilled with the pool they would of been happy to stay there all day. We were minutes from Gatorland, Disney etc.. and close to the flea markerts and restaurants which was great. The breakfast was great and was the coffee. Staff were friendly and were helpful. Can't wait to go back again. Made our first trip to florida very memorable,

Reviews.Title: “Another Comfortable Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mrspiggy549
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites Maingate is just that...A place to stay where your comfort is the #1 priority. Ted, at the front desk, makes you feel welcome as soon as you step into the lobby. Rooms are roomy, breakfast is fast and yummy, housekeeping keeps your room clean and tidy, the beds are dreamy, transportation to the theme parks is on time and user-friendly & the location is central to all points of interest, especially food. For those on a budget, a Winn-Dixie supermarket is within walking distance of the hotel. Combine that with the fridge & microwave right in your room, and you'll be saving lottsa $$$. Enjoy your stay...I always do!

Reviews.Title: “A Clean Solid "3+" for Us”
Reviews.Author: grayesun
Reviews.Content: Compared to the weak "3" for the hotel we stayed in on St Pete beach prior to spending a night here...anyway, the check-in was speedy; we were looking for a large room for 4 adults and were offered a jacuzzi suite, then opted instead for 2 separate rooms (one with 2 queens and 1 with a king). Desk clerk had little info to provide on acquiring Disney tickets. Shuttle to park was available, but we had missed last run of the day. Both rooms were immaculate, fresh and clean, exterior hallways, stairways, grounds, pool and parking areas were all in fine shape as well. Ice machine near us on 2nd floor was broken. All was quiet outside at night in spite of the many teen-agers staying here we saw the next morning at the fine free breakfast buffet. The drive to Epcot was about 20 minutes. Would have given this place a "4" with a better price to stay or a break on getting 2 rooms. As we see on-line today, better rates were available at more upscale hotels than this, but visiting Epcot was a last minute decision.

Reviews.Title: “Decent for the Price Near Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Travelalot963
Reviews.Content: For the price, not a bad motel, but not really good either. The motel is just down the road about 2 miles from the entrance, World Dr., to Walt Disney World. The staff were not very friendly or helpful. They did not warn guests about the super hot doors on the rooms facing the evening sun. They were so super hot they burned you upon touching any part to enter your room! Our room had a funky odor, so we went to the woman at the check-in desk and said we had to have another room because the room smelled. She was not a customer friendly person at all! She finally gave us another room and said if that does not work, they may have to get us a fan, they could not give us another room (even though the motel never appeared to have an occupancy above 50% while we were there for the week)! The free hot breakfast was decent with the regular eggs, sausage, cereal, coffee, orange & apple juice, some small muffins. toast, and waffles. They had an outside swimming pool and adjacent cabana bar for which they gave each guest 2 "buy one, get one free" drink coupons. No one used the pool as far as we could see, and only 2 others were using the bar. The free fairly expensive drink we paid for was a bad Margarita in a plastic glass over some ice (they did not have "frozen Margaritas). The bed was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Transportation Changed Drastically”
Reviews.Author: mom4onthego
Reviews.Content: If you rely on bus transportation, please rethink this hotel. I hate to write this review. We have stayed here for years and loved the hotel, BUT the transportation to Disney changed and you cannot arrive at the parks until two hours or more after they open. We were extremely disappointed and had to change hotels after one day in the parks. The biggest dissappointment was that they withheld the information when we booked the room and said the transportation was the same as last year. They put a big stress on our family vacation. The biggest expense to the Disney trip are the tickets and getting there 2 hours late is not acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will stay again”
Reviews.Author: themeparkjunkie5
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here. The first was in 2008 and I am happy to report the hotel is well-maintained. It was a great deal for the money. We were able to get a suite with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed for $75 plus taxes/fees (Florida resident rate). This included free shuttles to-and-from the Disney parks saving us $14/day parking and included breakfast for the family which saved us even more. Breakfast consisted of scrambled eggs & sausage, 2 waffle makers (1 makes Mickey Mouse waffles), cold cereals, toast, muffins, fruits, yogurts, milk, juices, and coffee. The property is well-maintained inside & out. Nicely landscaped. Pool with clean towels poolside. Good amount of staff restocking breakfast buffet and cleaning premises. Felt safe. Rooms spacious and included a mini fridge and microwave. Hotel within walking distance of several restaurants and a Winn Dixie grocery store. Rooms quiet at night, beds comfortable with good amount of pillows. Only negative comments would be the tv reception was not clear and the eggs weren't the best.

Reviews.Title: “There have to be better places”
Reviews.Author: CdnWarthog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites March 15 - 21, 2010. The hotel was booked through Sunwing Vacations and quite frankly at this price point they could have done better. I have stayed at Comfort Suites and Comfort Inns across North America and have come to expect an average experience with as Holiday Inn used to say, no surprises. The room, cleanliness and general appearance of the hotel were fairly normal for a Comfort property. The front desk staff were less than friendly. When asked on the first morning how to get to Epcot they said turn left at the highway, go about two miles and take the Disney exit, then follow the signs. While that was easy enough I would have appreciated a map and a bit of personality in the answer. Each morning I went out for a run, upon my return I bid the front desk clerk good morning, this was usually answered with a grunt or a single word response. Every other hotel I haave stayed at around the world, the response was usually an inquiry about my run or a comment about the weather. The Comfort Suites offers a continental breakfast. This was probably the least inspired continental breakfast I have ever seen. Fruit consisted of oranges and grapefruit (no big surprise as this is Floriday) and bananas if you get there before 7:10 when they seem to disappear. The hot dish changed daily, but if you didn't like pork products stirred into your eggs you were out of luck most days, We couldn't get our shower to turn on the first morning and I must say they had a maintenance man up to our room immediately to attend to it. Unfortunately the shower dripped for the rest of our stay. My recommendation...shop around, there have to be better choices.

Reviews.Title: “One of the better hotels along 192”
Reviews.Author: Deb_Mpls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Great location - only about 1 mile from Disney so we were able to go to Disney early in the morning, then take a break in the afternoon and come back to the hotel to "refresh" and lay by the pool for a few hours and then go back for the evening and fireworks. The hotel grounds are very clean, everything looks like it has been freshly painted. Free wi-fi but was slow and sometimes had trouble connecting. Large pool and very large hot tub. Hot tub could have been hotter but it fit about 15 people easily and we had great conversations with other guests at night here. Breakfast was very good, cereal, muffins, toast, english muffins, fruit, yogurt, juice, milk, make your own waffle makers (even one shaped like Mickey), plus a hot entree every morning that changed. One day was scrambled eggs and sausage, another biscuits and gravy, another ham and cheese omelets. They serve a lot of people and if you come between 9:00 - 10:00 I thinks it's the busiest and they try to keep up with the amount of people they are serving. If they ran out of something (hot breakfast) we just asked and they made more. Only things I didn't like about our room is that the dresser was small - only 3 drawers and the room could have been a bit bigger for 4 adults, and the shower and sink are in one room. We prefer the sink to be outside of the bathroom so that 4 people can get ready at once. It would help if they would at least have a mirror above the dresser. Not really a complaint - just a preference. Across the street from the hotel is TGIF, a pizza place,WinnDixie grocery store, and miniature golf. Very convenient. If you need a Target there is one about a 1/2 mile west of the hotel. We didn't notice this until the last day as we were always going East out of the parking lot to get to Disney, etc - never went the other direction until the last day! Rates for the hotel were running $65-$89 when we were there so at this price I would definately stay here again. NOTE: You'll find places advertising discount Disney tickets (used tickets) - If you're wondering here's how it works: You have to go at 8:00 in the morning and see what they have available. You can get a Disney Ticket for $60 for the day (versus $84 at the gate), but beware, you have to be prepared to lie at the gate as your finger print won't match the ticket (when you buy tickets now the first time you use it your finger is scanned and it is matched to your ticket) and then you'll have to convince them that the machine must not be working right because it worked yesterday and yes, it's really your ticket. We weren't comfortable with doing that and didn't think it was worth the risk or hassle of having the ticket then confiscated as I've heard that they do take you aside and take your ticket if they think it's not yours. Not sure if that's true but we decided it wasn't worth the risk.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: wishitwaswarmhere
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean. The continental breakfast was good and generous. The staff was friendly. We have stayed at a lot of hotels in Florida, and they are always iffy. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. The bartender in the cabana was so nice. We forgot our backpack, and she turned it into the front desk for us, intact. Thanks a bunch for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable & Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: VIVAHUME
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 days while visiting Orlando. The hotel was pretty moderate in terms of amenities but was clean and comfortable. The staff was friendly and helpful whenever we asked for assistance. The room we stayed in could have comfortably slept about 6 people with two queen beds, and a pull-out from the sofa. The room also had a fridge-freezer combo, coffee maker, iron, TV and microwave - all welcome things to see. The on-site amenities included a pool, hot(?) tub and some charcoal BBQs that you could use, which I thought were a nice touch. They served a complimentary breakfast in the morning which included some cereals, fruits, coffee, toast and waffle makers. In addition, they seemed to also have 1 varying hot item (ex. eggs). The place is a stones throw from Disney and you can see the fireworks from the grounds. There are a number of restaurants withing walking distance, as well as an internet cafe, grocery store and liquor store.

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: mikenamy93
Reviews.Content: We spent over $100 per night for a room with a clogged drain and insects. The breakfast was poor quality and inadequate supply for the amount of customers. There was a large swarm of ants in the breakfast area. The hotel charges $1 per page to print out even boarding passes and the manager would not even make an exception under the circumstances. The manager's attitude was the poorest I have ever experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great value, good breakfast...would stay here again happily.”
Reviews.Author: clearlyrachel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the weekend here with our two children plus our niece and nephew (7,12,13,14) and we had enough room to be comfortable. The pool and hot tub area was clean and we enjoyed hanging out here for a bit. The bathroom was clean and modern and shower pressure was good, too. The bed was very comfortable and the pillows were clean and fluffy. The breakfast was a great value for our family. We were pleasantly surprised by the choices and quality. Our kids loved making Micky Belgian Waffles in the morning! They also featured bacon and cheese omelets while we were there alongside the normal fare of cereals, fruit, toast, pastry, juices, coffee, hot cocoa and yogurt. We will definitely stay here again as the cleanliness and value can't be beat. Also, several restaurants are within walking distance and it was a very easy 7 minute drive to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, quiet hotel, a break from the theme parks”
Reviews.Author: golfer09Sask
Reviews.Content: Not the greatest continental breakfast for Canadians, but the accommodations made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort/Honesty”
Reviews.Author: chrisjohn2
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites Maingate, FL, (FL550) We stayed 3-nights, 10.23-10.26. Our stay was enhanced by the 'Comfort' of the Comfort Inn personnel at this location. This 'Comfort' continued even after we had left! After arriving at our home in Melbourne, FL, I found my backpack missing; this pack contained my jogging clothes and equipment (timing watch, chest strap, etc) and some personal items (keys, ear plugs, etc). I immediately called the motel and first talked to the associate at the front desk (name not recorded), as I understood, and she put me in touch with Adriana, Chief Housekeeper. Adriana quickly confirmed that my backpack had been turned in and they had a system for sending it back. Wow ... what great news and what excellent service ... honesty plus service, GREAT! My pack was delievered to my home yesterday at a cost of $23. Pretty darn good. Thank you to the Motel management, the front desk clerk and especially to the staff of room service and the Chief Housekeeper, Adriana. Management is obviously doing something right to receive service such as this, and the honesty of the housekeeper's staff demands and deserves special recognition. Sincerely, John and Christel Horsch

Reviews.Title: “Best maintained older property”
Reviews.Author: kjt7ken
Reviews.Content: Excellent condition and clean for a property that has been around a while. Friendly staff, very clean rooms and pool and excellent price. A lot of Motels up and down I-95 could take a lesson.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel we've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: mominparadise
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean hotel and a decent breakfast...look no further! While the rooms are on the small side, they are still quite adequate if you don't plan on spending a lot of time inside. The beds were super comfy, and suprisingly the pull out sofa wasn't too bad either. Our family of 6 stayed here for 2 weeks and had zero complaints. The maid service was super, we never had one issue. The continnental breakfast was a real savings too, and offered a decent variety. Granted we were there at a slow time of year, so I think if you want to get a seat in the breakfast area and get close to a waffle maker, be there as early as you can. The pool and pool area were exceptional. Very clean and warm, and there were always towels available. The tiki bar was a bonus. We would stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Had a Mahvalous time!”
Reviews.Author: ker0275
Reviews.Content: We had already booked our room via the Comfort Inn web page and got a great deal with a military discount. When we arrived, we decided to check out other room options because my husband and I wanted to have a little privacy from the usual 2 queen beds in one room since we were traveling with our two teenage daughters. The front desk was great and gave us a couple of options to check out. We decided to take their room with one bedroom with King bed, jacuzzi tub, queen sleeper sofa and kitchenette for only$20 more a night. This met all of our needs for our kids and our privacy. The rooms were clean and the staff was great. The included free breakfast is a great asset as is the bus service to the parks. I also love the pool and the pool bar. They're great for relaxing on the days we took off from visiting all the attractions. The grounds are neat and clean and well kept. There are a ton of restaurants surrounding the hotel, as well as, a grocery store and gift shops so we were able to eat out of eat in. The convenience was one of the key reasons we stayed there. My family and I would stay there again in a heartbeat. Well worth what we paid to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: Whiyeannblack
Reviews.Content: The hotel seemed nice but at my husband and I had to change rooms at 1am with our 3 month old son because we were geting eatin alive by bed bugs in the bed.there was conviently no manager there ALL weekend and when I finally spoke to one that following Tuesday because again conviently she was off on the Monday also she told that they ciuldent find any bed bugs so I could not prove it the dozens of bites on me my husband an my baby wernt enough. So the did nothing for me I still had to pay for my stay and I alslo had to pay to have all my belongings dry cleaned so that the bed bugs did not infest my home.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: disneymemories
Reviews.Content: Check in was quick and easy. Grounds were beautiful and clean. Our room was large enough for the 4 of us and was always cleaned properly. The fridge and microwave served us well so we didn't always have to eat out. Also there was a safe which was free with the room. The grocery store was close but pricey and there was lots of restraunts within walking distance. There is a Super Target about a 15 minute walk from the hotel with sidewalks to get there. The morning breakfast had a good selection with a different hot item each day. There were 3 different cereals, bread, fruit,english muffins, juices, tea or coffee, donuts, waffles and the hot item. We never had a problem with time share people harassing us. They were always nice to talk too. The employees were friendly especially the front desk lady Vashie. The pool area was well maintained and the water was clean and warm. The shuttles came at 730, 1010 or 12. Return times were 715, 845 or 1030. It only took 15 minutes to arrive at the TTC and then you transfer to Disney transportation. The water parks and Downtown Disney took the longest to get to (45 minutes) but we made it work. So glad after we saw some of the traffic jams. Seaworld and Universal times were 855 pickup from the hotel and 8 pickup from the parks. It was about an hour ride back from Universal which was too long. Seaworld was about 30 minutes. They gave us a third floor room facing the pool and Disney. We could see the nightly fireworks from both Magic Kingdom and Epcot. I would definately stay here again when I visit Orlando. Thanks for the wonderful memories.

Reviews.Title: “really nice, close to disney!”
Reviews.Author: momof2Cambridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Aug 2009. It was a pleasant suprise to check in after a long 19hr drive from Ontario, Canada. The rooms look new and are a good size. Very clean and very nice bathroom. The pool is very warm and nice as well. Breakfast was good and always repleished, the room is a little small though, can get crowded. Free 15mins high speed internet is nice, used that every day. Many restaurants, grocery stores and pretty much everything you need within walking distance. Disney is only about 10 minutes away. We would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average (Plus) stay”
Reviews.Author: GermanyTwinsFan
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation at this hotel based on a previous stay here while in Orlando. The hotel is still a good place to stay, but not as nice as I remember it. It was comfortable and clean, and provided all our families needs. The rooms appeared a little smaller this time around, but that is due to my growing children. If you have small children then a there should be no probelms. The breakfast was disappointing this time around. Last time they offered more choices, but this time it was the standard fare of juices, coffee, breads, cereals, and a waffle maker. Not as big of a fruit and egg selection as before. The hotel was busy on the dates of my stay, and I think that the staff was doing the best they could to keep up, but it didn't really take away from our stay there. Everybody was professional and courteous and there were no issues at check-in and check out. Overall I would recommend this hotel for anybody looking for a good place to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “NIce place, close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: liquidjas
Reviews.Content: This was a nice, very clean motel. I actually stayed here for free because I viewed a timeshare across the street that paid for the room. I'm not sure what the normal price would be, but if under $100 it's definately worth it. There is a pool w/ bar and jacuzzi. The Continental breakfast was descent, but as with all hotel/motels make sure you get there before the rush if you want the hot foods. It's close to Disney/Universal/Sealworld, etc. Lots of restaurants within walking distance of your room. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place, Close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: EKEWTravels
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here with our two toddlers while on a road trip. We unexpectedly stayed here after staying at Magic Kingdom too long and not wanting to drive again. Check in was nice (and they honored the coupon we had received at the Florida Welcome Center on I-95). The room was big enough to accommodate two pack-and-plays without tripping over each other. We used the wireless internet once and it connected pretty quickly. The beds and the room were clean. The bathroom was one of the nicest we have seen in a hotel. We ate at the continental breakfast, it was what you would expect, and very crowded when we went. Overall, this would be a good place for a family to stay if they were going on a trip to WDW and trying to save some money staying off site. They also have a little gift shop with Disney/Florida souvenirs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Close to Disney location”
Reviews.Author: siskacat7
Reviews.Content: We were pleasently surprised with this hotel when we stayed sping break.We were traveling to watch our band kids perform at Disney so we stayed at the same hotel.The rooms were large and updated with nice bedding and had a nice size bathroom.The beds were really comfortable.It was not noisy at all. The pool was heated to a comfortable temperature which is really a rarity these days.It took just minutes to reach the Disney parks and travel to the parks was VERY EASY.It was nice that there were so many good restuarants within walking distance as well as a grocery store next door.The room had a microwave and a small refrigerator.We really liked the in room safe also.I would definitely stay here again.The front desk staff was very nice and accomadating.A rental car would not be needed if you were only going to the parks as they provide a shuttle;however if you like to come and go on your own schedule you may need one.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place for a family going to Disney”
Reviews.Author: scottgriffith22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights in a Queen Suite with a sofa bed pullout. It is tough sometimes to find a reasonably price room for a family of 5. We got a good government rate so with the free breakfast it made it that much better because we were able to save a little cash that way. It's definitely not the Embassy but I'm sure it's as good as the Value Resorts on Disney property and about a 1/3 the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JJTrain
Reviews.Content: Two night break from a family visit to south FL, spent at SeaWorld & Disney (EP & MK). I mention the destinations to stress the excellent location, not to mention the free shuttle to parks, which, now that I think of it, we were foolish not to use (so I can't comment on). Accommodations were very good; room was spacious and comfortable, beds fine, bathroom fine except for erratic water flow in shower, which we noted in subsequent online satisfaction survey. Breakfast very adequate, albiet crowded, especially around park opening schedule (8-8:30AM), to be expected. Well supplied and very good. Thought the Mickey shaped waffle iron was a nice touch. Heated outdoor pool, didn't go in, just dipped a toe, but others swam and enjoyed. Clean and inviting, especially to a frustrated (aka freezing) northeasterner like me. Check-in & check-out smooth, desk staff helpful and informative. Also, location at one end of a big strip mall with many restaurants for a reasonably priced dinner (vs. dining within the parks). All in all great value at $75/nt + taxes (govt. discount).

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as I expected.”
Reviews.Author: bulletbender
Reviews.Content: When we rolled up to an exterior Comfort Suites, I couldn't help but think the age of the property was going to show through the room. First, I'd like to say that if you lower your expectations of amenities the way they are today, you'll be happy with this room. By that, I mean everything was clean, and that to me is the most important amenity a hotel/motel can offer. TV was small. No writing desk, no executive chair. Bathrooms however had vanity inside and not outside(which must have been part of a renovation effort). But could use a mirror in the room. Breakfast, even though I'm not a breakfast eater, seemed great. Could use some better lighting outside. Also, nice touch for the type of place this is(meaning close to Disney) to have a game room in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: ellenelbrms
Reviews.Content: This very attractive and well maintained hotel is conveniently located near the Disney parks, complete with complimentary transportation. The rooms are large and pleasant, the pool area beautiful, and the lobby and breakfast room cheerful. The complimentary breakfast was also top notch. The guest service is prompt and courteous. Excellent value and a most enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Grossly Overpriced, Overated & Glorified In The Pictures”
Reviews.Author: KatyDeeUK
Reviews.Content: Having used the reviews on this website as a guide before booking this hotel, I was incredibly disappointed. Plus points: Basic rooms, clean enough with fridge & coffee maker a reasonable distance from the resorts with a free bus. Breakfast til 10am. Negatives: Despite us smiling and being friendly and polite, the check-in guy had no pleansantries and a rude off-hand manner. The pool looks far better & bigger in the pics than it actually is. Don't waste your money on a poolside room, the hotel is small enough to just walk around with total ease. The breakfast was limited and consisted of mainly cheap, sweet foods with few healthy options. Dated bedding with blankets but beds comfortable enough Employ geriatrics on the resort ticket sales desk who try and oversell with 2 speeds slow and stop despite being advised several times we were in a hurry as the bus was waiting for us outside! To sure to put the DO NOT DISTURB sign on the door if you do not wish to be awoken with cleaners sharply rapping on the door before 9am. The FREE internet consists of 15 minutes per day, you pay after that and has no hotel computer so you have to take your own to make use of it! Safe in room but would not open as per instructions so useless. I stayed in a similar hotel off International Drive a few years ago which I sadly can't remember the name but it was only around $35 per night and apart from the decent coffee maker was of the same standard & facilities. Total rip-off and would never stay at a Comfort Suites again. There are loads of cheaper hotels in the prime area so I would definitely go for one of those next time. Don't forget tax is also added to the room rate adding over $11 cost per night on an $89 room. I can only assume other reviewers did not have anything to compare to in the area but this was a highly over-rated and expensive base for our holiday and a costly mistake I will never repeat again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good Hotel (Detailed Review)”
Reviews.Author: hayes17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel from October 16th-25th 2008 for our first family vacation. We had a great time! It was a great time of year to go. Everything was fairly quiet at the hotel (a little busier on weekends). One night, there were some loud guests coming in late at night, but we were by the stairs, so that could have contributed. The weather was very nice, not too cold and not too hot, but nice enough to go to a water park. The parks weren't crowded except for the time of the fireworks. We didn't wait for more than 10 minutes for most rides. The location of the hotel is great! It is very close to everything Disney. It takes about 10 minutes or less (depending on the roads you take) to get to Disney. About 15-20 minutes to Universal. We could watch the Disney fireworks from the top floor of the hotel every night (one of the highlights of our trip). You could also see many of the Disney parks (Tree of Life, Everest) from the top floor. There were a lot of restaurants right across the parking lot from the hotel (Cracker Barrell, a nice Italian/pizza restaurant, TGI Fridays, Subway, and a supermarket. Everything we needed was right there. There was even a security guard that patrolled at night. The area feels very safe, I think it is just a way to make guests feel safer. The hotel is pretty nice. It is nothing incredibly fancy, but the hotel is clean, the beds are very comfortable, and the staff is friendly. Rooms come with a free continental breakfast with everything you could want (make-your-own-waffles, fruit, cereal, eggs, toast, bagels). Each day there are different hot selections. The pool area is nice. There is a water mushroom for the kids. There is a hot tub as well, which we used almost every night. Good size too. The first night, it was lukewarm but we told the staff and it was fixed the next night and stayed that way. There is a poolside bar (very nice). Some of the funnest times were sitting out in the hot tub at night, sipping on a drink, running up to watch the fireworks from the top floor, then coming down and seeing a baby raccoon or an armadilllo running around the property outside the fence. We had 2 rooms. The one room was very nice. The other was the same, but needed some updating (wrinkled carpet in one area). However, we did see that there were workers there every day and there were 2-3 rooms that were being redone. So it looks like this hotel does try to upkeep the rooms well. The rooms are a decent size. Our rooms had 2 double beds and then a little half wall with a pull out couch on the other side. Bathrooms are spacious with marble-like sinks. Showers worked great. Nice pressure and temperature. There was a nice size refrigerator in the rooms and a small safe. Everything worked properly in the rooms. Overall, a very nice location and nice stay. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort Suites saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Doreen17
Reviews.Content: This was our second time at the Comfort Suites Maingate. Originally we were booked at the Fairfield Inn on International Dr. We wanted to be closer to Universal this time. After one night there we knew we didn't want to stay another. The beds were so soft that we were in pain the next day. We both wanted to go back to the Comfort Suites. We showed up with no reservation but got a room with no problem for the rest of the week. The beds were much better. The hotel staff was very friendly. The pool and hot tub were great and open till 11:00 pm. Breakfast was included and it was great. You could even make your own waffles. Mario does a fabulous job taking care of the breakfast room. There were several restaurants within walking distance and a supermarket. Sherberth Rd was about half a mile away and takes you right to the Animal Kingdom, from there you can get to everything Disney. We were very comfortable at the Comfort Suites and will always stay there from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place / good value”
Reviews.Author: rcpeterson
Reviews.Content: Stayed 25 Oct - 2 Nov. This is a really nice hotel, very convenient to shops, restaurants, and attractions. There is a mall within walking distance next door with anything needed. The pool was very large, and quite warm. Hot tub was also very spacious. There is a snack bar at the pool for drinks, hot dogs and chips, etc.... Good selection at breakfast - waffle machines, pastries and muffins, toast, etc... and also a hot egg/meat dish each day (e.g. ham and cheese omelets, biscuits and gravy, etc) And there are packets of instant oatmeal now, mixed in with hot choc packs. Rooms were clean, and have fridge and micro. We had a problem one day with the ac unit, but the maint. guy was at my door before I got back from the front desk. All rooms open to the outside to covered walkways. We were on the third floor (of three) which was perfect for us. All the staff were super-friendly. We WOULD definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed”
Reviews.Author: tabatc
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 11/02-11/06, and we were really impressed with the hotel. The biggest plus for this hotel was the location. Just a short hop to Animal Kingdom using Sherbeth Road (in fact, you can see Expedition Everest from the third floor norh-facing walkways) and very short drives to the rest of the Disney attractions. The room was clean and well stocked with towels. The only problem was a finicky shower valve that was hard to adjust. Once we mastered it, no further problems Even though the hotel was on the main highway, it was super quiet. Many restaurants were within walking distance and, compared to Disney prices, were pretty reasonable price-wise. The free contiental breakfast was another positive with a variety of hot items available including waffles. Pool was great except that the jets in the whirlpool were out. Overall, an excellent hotel. We are already looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Great Price!!”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaDisneyLover
Reviews.Content: We had difficulty finding this hotel...Orlando is quite the confusing city for me! I can manage Chicago, Dallas, and Indianapolis, but Orlando! So many toll roads and state roads...oy...but anyway! We got on the phone with a nice lady in the afternoon on the 9th of October, and she talked my son to the hotel over the cell phone! She was marvelous, and I wish we could remember her name, but she was incredibly nice and very polite! Loved our room. It was clean, comfy and worked out for our party of five just fine. We walked to the Cracker Barrel for dinner and my son and his grandpa played checkers and then we headed back to our room. It was small, especially for five people in the room, but it was adequate for our needs. We only needed one night, because we moved on to a three bedroom villa at Grand Beach Resort the next day. The grounds and rooms are extremely clean. I can't think of anything they need to improve on! Very nice, friendly staff, and a great breakfast buffet in the morning. I agree with another reviewer though that there should be some oatmeal provided. That would be a nice change from all the sugary stuff provided. Still, that is a minor beef for a great hotel at such a reasonable price. It is close to everything in the area, and you can't beat the price. For a room with two queen beds, a sofa/sleeper, fridge and microwave, I paid only 73.00. Great value for such a fine hotel. Kudos to the staff of this wonderful place in a sea of hotels/motels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for standard”
Reviews.Author: dgas30
Reviews.Content: Arrived after midnight due to 5hr flight delay, security guard opened reception doors and there was a guy behind the desk ready to check us in. The hotel is located far enough off the main road of the I-192 for you not to hear any traffic noise and there are some very good restaurants in walking distance, namely Cracker Barrell, Red lobster etc. and there is a Perkins and Dennys just up the road for a good breakfast. In no time at all we were given our keys and a map of the hotel showing us where our room was. we drove round the back of the building to find our room on the ground floor. we didnt really want a groundfloor room due to external corridors and the security, but our fears were not needed. The hotel has security on site so felt safe and secure. We parked literally outside our room door. the aircon had been left on in the room making it nice and cool, although the room did have a very slight damp feel to it, again, probably because the aircon had been on for a very long time. The hotel room was fairly big, it had a small sofa near the door (presumabley converts to bed by look of it) a coffee table and small table with chairs. there are two very comfortable queen size beds, tv with all the usual cable channels, clock radio, small wardrobe with iron and ironing board. Fridge and microwave aswell as a coffee maker. the bathroom was very spacious with an excellent shower! the room was cleaned daily and kept immaculate. only thing we noticed was that you could hear the tv from the next room and because we were on the groundfloor peoples cars were parked right outside, not a major problem when we were there because the hotel seemed desserted. We only had breakfast once, which consisted of a very simple self service of toast, waffles, cereal, yoghurt etc. even though the hotel was very quiet when we were there the breakfast room got busy for space. Location; excellent for disney parks and downtown disney (not even a few miles away) but about 15 mins drive to seaworld, and bit longer for universal. Overall; good for value/cost and excellent location for disney, clean, bright and generally good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Becca-Beach-Bum
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the first and the last 2 nights of our holiday in February 08. Location - The reason we stayed here was because of it's location and it didn't let us down. Several good Restaurants within walking distance and a supermarket. The major roads like the I-4 are 2 mins down the road. Hotel - plenty of parking and not a high rise. One of the smaller hotels in the area which seemed to make people more friendly. Rooms - Clean, Good size, quiet and the beds were so comfy. Good shower and room had a fridge and coffee maker and the important safe. Pool - Really nice for the size of the hotel and it had a bar outside. Jacuzzi was lovely too. Breakfast - ok same as everywhere else but it was included in the room so can't complain that there was no full English! I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaOSU
Reviews.Content: I have been to Kissimmee numerous times over the last 15 years and I have stayed in some very bad hotels and some very nice ones. This was a very nice one...Actually I was pleasantly surprised. Customer service was excellent, hot breakfast bar was great, and the room was nice as well..I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close, and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pixiedust011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 7 days. The breakfast is outstanding. Cereal, bagels, donuts, juice, milk, coffee, bread, waffles, and eggs. It saved money on going out to breakfast every morning. We drove to Disney World every morning and found it to be easy and fast to get there, with almost not traffic. Arriving back to the hotel was great to find a clean and cold room. The air conditioners work great. The housekeepers did more than a terrific job. Cleanliness matters most to me. The pool is beautifully lit at night and perfect temperature. The pool area is a lot more crowded at night. Very relaxing and roomy hot tub. They have a bar that makes great strawberry daiquiris . They even have a kiddie pool with mushroom fountain. This hotel is perfect for the price. I am returning next year and look forward to staying with them again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel awesome pool area but narrow rooms”
Reviews.Author: Angelicro
Reviews.Content: We booked a two night stay at this hotel for the 2008 Fourth of July weekend. The hotel looks fairly new. The grounds are beautifully tropical landscaped and oh so clean. The kiddie pool was separate from the big pool & had a fountain that sprayed downwards which made it fun for small children to play in. There were plenty of plastic chairs and lounge chairs around the pool. They could use a few more tables with umbellas on them as there were only a small number of them and they were always taken with people who placed their towels & belongings on the top of them but never seemed to sit at them. They have a nice little outside bar. There was a microwave & a small refrigerator in the room. The free buffet breakfast was great and the breakfast room very clean. It had the best coffee, orange juice, apple juice, muffins, make your own waffles, bagels, toast, cereals and always a delicious egg dish freshly made each morning for guests. One day we had omelets another day it was scrambled eggs with cheese on top. We found that the entire staff were awesome in all areas of this hotel. ALL of them were very caring and very professional from the inside & outside housekeeping reps to the desk clerks to the breakfast room staff. Parking was close & easy. The rooms are very clean and fresh smelling but there were negative's to the first floor room we rented across from the pool. The rooms are very narrow inside. They are decorated simply but nicely but there are no closets to hang your clothes only a small upright armorie. There is a dresser with drawers and end tables but it made the room seem even more narrow. There was a very small round table with two chairs in the room also. I couldn't put our luggage on the floor anywhere because there was just no room to walk through. The furniture armorie did not have enough space to hang both clothes and store your luggage bags inside. Who ever designed the room size was way off base compared to the rest of the hotel which is just wonderful. The beds are very comfortable and they give you 10 nice pillows per room and extra sheets & blankets. There were only two of us in the room which they charged us $125.00 a night. We could not imagine more than two people staying in these rooms because they are just to narrow. They should have built the rooms wider especially since they call them "suites". It had a divider placed between one bed & the small sofa which closed in the room more. Other than the narrow room size negative the rest of the hotel is nice, clean, new and the staff very attentive to guests. We give the staff and outside pool areas 100% positive and room size a total negative for the size & price they charged us. The location is excellent & close to everything. If you do not stay in the room much like we had to because of the rainy weather that weekend or don't mind narrow sized areas without closets this is the hotel for you because the rest of the hotel and its staff made it a big plus!

Reviews.Title: “pretty good - not perfect”
Reviews.Author: AAFZ
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on so many positive reviews. It was fine/ok but not perfect, and I'm not sure I'd stay there again. I think the hotel is a little dated -- could use new rugs and some general updating. However, given that, it still felt clean and the breakfast, large room, and free Internet were selling points by comparison to the Disney properties. It is very close to Disney, which is great! However, you have to remember that when you leave Disney to enter Kissimmee, things will seem a little less spiffy. For some that will be a nice break, for others (like me) it felt a little disappointing. Another thing to know is that quick, healthy food on-the-run is really hard to find in Kissimmee. There are many chain and buffet restaurants, but at the end of a long Disney day, we just wanted a wrap or burrito, not a long sit-down meal when we're exhausted. So, besides the hotel being just slightly less than I expected, lack of quick/easy food was also difficult. For large families on a budget this hotel might be a good choice. However, since there were only three of us, we could have had more flexibility and next time I'd do it differently -- probably a cheap Disney property (since food is imperfect either way) in order to get the great pool and other Disney-only benefits.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Horrible customer service.”
Reviews.Author: comfortsuitesterr
Reviews.Content: Night Staff inappropriate, rude and immature and immature. Night Staff insisted that this customer get out of her car with her young children and pick up an oversized pizza box at the side of the garbage can and stuff it in the garbage can at midnight. He was unprofessional and disrespectful to our family. When requested, this night clerk refused to give the name or phone number of the Hotel Manager. When we retired to our room, he called the police, whereby we should have called the police for his harassment. The police advised we bypass this hotel management and contact the Branch Manager. We've made two attempts tocontact the Hotel Manager, Jamie Stolinas, but she does not return our calls. We will take this up with Upper Management. We are disputing all charges based on their 100% satisfaction guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: QueenSheeba
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with two teenage boys in May 2008. The hotel was pretty clean. The front desk staff was not overly friendly or helpful compared to the cleaning staff. The pool was fairly big and there was a snack bar where you could order drinks and sandwiches. The free breakfast was great ... lots of selections, hot and cold. There are free shuttles to Disney and Universal Studios but beware the shuttle to Universal is only once a day and for the return shuttle you are on the bus for an hour and a half because of all the stops it does along the way. There were 3 Disney shuttles but they only go to Magic Kingdom and from there you have to transfer to go to the other parks. The buses come fairly often so i was never too much of a wait. There are plenty of restaurants around the hotel and also a grocery store. Do not recommend this hotel is you are going to Florida for Universal Studios otherwise it was pretty decent for the price.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous place to stay, loved it, strongly advise others to try it”
Reviews.Author: devoncutie
