Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel, and loved every minute. The front desk receptionist was friendly and welcoming. Lovely room, large and very clean, good amenities. The housekeeping girl very smiley and helpfull. The swimming Pool was absolutely fabulous, large and very open, rooms overlook on two sides, but lots of open space at one end, with step up to spa. I was in it every day, mid morning was lovely and quiet, when most of the guests have gone to the parks. Breakfast was very good with plenty of choice, I love the waffles you cook yourself. We picked this hotel for its location, and were not disappointed. So close to Disney, just a short drive to the other attractions, convenient for the main Interstate 4, and Osceola Parkway, plus the new 429, which gives very easy access to Disney via the back way. Walking from the hotel is every eating place you could want, all the well known names within just a few minutes, plus a supermarket and other stores. We will be staying again hopefully in July.

Reviews.Title: “perfect, clean family hotel for FL and Disney”
Reviews.Author: HHAL
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean. The rooms were arranged nicely for families and were big enough. There is a larger than average mini fridge in the room and a microwave. There was a good variety of channels on the tv. The pool was fun and big enough for kids of all ages. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was a treat for the kids too- Mickey Mouse waffles. The property was close to shopping, restaurants and Disney. I was surprised of how much we got for the price. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: gb856
Reviews.Content: Nice clean hotel, but we had a few minor complaints. Requested a pool view room, but a large tree blocked the view of the pool area. They had a nice breakfast selection, but you had to wait a very long time to make your own waffles. Their were two waffle machines available, but some people were making two or three at a time. There was also one female front desk clerk who needed a personality make over.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: iLoveShadow16
Reviews.Content: I`ve read everyone of the reviews here before booking this hotel, and we all loved it. There was 5 people in the room and we all fit very comfortably. I slept on the pull out couch and it was pretty comfortable. Our room was 532, and it was on the 3rd floor, we requested it because they said you could see the fireworks from there, but you can just walk up there, because after a whole day at the park we didnt want to walk up 3 flights of stairs. The breakfast was good, it saved a lot of money. It also changes everyday. We were going to take the shuttles, but there was only about 2 pick ups and drops off. There is a little store in the lobby that sells pops and ice cream. Right across from the hotel is a Cracker Barrel, and a TGI Fridays right there were you could walk to, also there was a Dairy Queen right there. Also the pool is opened 8-11, it was a good size, and VERY warm! There was also a bar right there, that had a happy hour. I think everyone in my family would stay there again. We loved it and for the money it was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: observer2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a newer building just off 92, the long and very busy commercial route that runs through Kissimmee. It is tucked behind a small theme park "Old Town" on Florida Plaza Drive. It is very convenient to get to the Disney and Universal Parks -- probably about 15 minutes in light traffic. The unit itself was very clean and a medium size. It featured two double or queen sized beds and a small efficiency (fridge, sink, microwave). Our room overlooked the pool. It is a nice pool/hot tub setup, with a water umbrella device for kids to run under. The bar by the pool seemed to close its doors at a reasonable hour so noise was not a problem late at night. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The free breakfast buffet was very nice -- actually very good food and popular with the guests. A bit crowded at certain times in the morning. Ample parking in a well lit lot. Lots of things to do on 92 -- restaurants, miniature golf, stores, flea markets, souvenir shops, etc. A positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFULL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: sanpat
Reviews.Content: We have today just returned from 10 days holiday at this wonderful hotel. The service cleanliness and atmosphere are second to none. The complimentary breakfast is a great way to start your day and you can choose to eat as much or little as you desire. The location is close to all the theme parks. We would certainly return to this hotel when staying in the Orlando area on any future occasion and would also not hesitate in recommending a stay to any one else. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable. Surrey England

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay here”
Reviews.Author: crunchie96
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property very close to Disney. We found it we could get to the Disney parks really fast by heading west from the hotel and taking the toll road rather than following the crowds going east on Hwy 192. While it's not the fanciest Comfort Suites I've stayed in, it certainly is one of the better ones. The rooms are accessed by outside hallways, but it seemed to be a safe location. Everything seemed clean and well kept. However, the beds didn't have that super crisp and clean feel that some hotel rooms have. Breakfast was about the same as any in this class of hotels. The breakfast seating area fills up fast, which could be a problem if the outside seating is unavailable due to rain. There are several restaurants in walking distance if you don't want to drive to dinner.

Reviews.Title: “What an Amazing Time!”
Reviews.Author: mauigirl621
Reviews.Content: My family came down from Indiana to enjoy my sons 4th Birthday earlier this year. We stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate and didn't want to leave!! The rooms were very clean and all of the staff was so friendly and helpful. You couldn't pass an employee without them telling you good moring with a big friendly smile! Rooms were very clean. Breakfast was terrific! Huge variety ! Very hot and fresh! Pool was beautiful, we also enjoyed the relaxing hot tub! Bathrooms had lots of counter space. The rooms were decorated very cozzy and neat. The beds were very inviting! Slept the best I have ever slept in a hotel!! I can't say enough wonderful things about this great priced hotel! Also, very conveniently located. Right next door was a terrific shopping plaza with a grocery store, a wide variety of restaurants and a neat little luggage store. By the way, the hotel room had a fridge so that we could keep snacks for the kids. Just a really great place to go. I have read the other reviews listed on this site and 9 out of 10 seem to be wonderful. I wouldn't let one bad review spoil such a great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: meandrizzo
Reviews.Content: Triple A recommended the hotel for us and we booked it for two nights, the first morning there my mother went to make coffee with the cheap coffee pot the hotel furnished in our room, as my mother put the lid back on her hand went in the coffee pot with the lid and sliced her thunb and pinky,I wrapped her hand and immeditaly called down to the lobby and they said they would send someone to clean the room, I actually had to ask where the emergency room was. When I arrived back from the hospital with my mother and 12 stiches laterno feeling in her pinky and dead tissue on the thumb they did not apoligize show any compasion whats so ever. all they said is they have to make a accident report and send in to their insurance company!!! horrible customer service!!! thank god for Lawyers

Reviews.Title: “clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: bwhorne
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean and quiet. Friendly staff. A nice big pool. I'm pretty particular, and so is my wife. We were both VERY pleased. Didn't have a restaurant in the hotel, bur there's a Cracker Barrel within walking distance (seriously, right next door). The buffet was convient but don't go expecting the place to yourself. Expect to wait in the waffel line, or opt to grab a quick muffin and banna on your way to the park. Our room was on the thrid floor on the western side facing a field. We asked for a room on the outside for quit, and it was very quiet. They offer a shuttle to DW but we opted to drive. Deffinetly better then above average. Excellent may be too high, but it describes it better then above average. I'll go back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: QueensMarine
Reviews.Content: This hotel was above average and a very good value. I only stayed hear one night before going to the Comfort Inn Maingate East about 2 miles east of this hotel. I may be being critical since I staye at the Maingate East which is far superior an newer. This hotel had exterior corridors which are not as nice as the interior ones at the Maingate East. This hotels rooms were also average and smaller. It was very celan. The pool area is almost twice as large as the Maingate East and is beautifally landscaped with palm trees. The breakfast are was acceptable but not as large and varied as the Maingate East. This hotel has no fitness room. Travelers should note that the traffic in this area is very heavy however if you go east of the I-4 near the Comfort Inn Maingate East traffic is much better. This hotel had many places to eat nearby and a publix supermarket a few blocks away. Very good hotel but the Maigate East is a better choice for a few dollars more.

Reviews.Title: “Took 5 granddaughters to DISNEY in 2006.”
Reviews.Author: Grandma17
Reviews.Content: Took 5 granddaughters to DISNEY in 3/2006, ages 3,7,12,14 and 19. Stayed for 1 week. Had a wonderful time and loved COMFORT INN MAINGATE. Now they do not want to stay ANYWHERE ELSE. The rooms are very clean, large enough, staff very friendly and the food was great. The atmosphere is awesome. Everything you would want or need is in walking distance. Food wise or medical. You cannot find another place better for the money. I liked it so much so that I came down to DISNEY by myself in October of 2007 for my 56th birthday and stayed for 1 week at Comfort Suite. I had a ball. Guess what, we are coming back for another week. We just love this place. Grandma Vivian

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Nice Experience!”
Reviews.Author: tlrjgc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for one night after a long day at Sea World. The hotel was about 20 minutes away in rush hour traffic. Check in was extremely fast and easy. The gentlemen at the front desk was courteous and helpful. He even went out of his way to provide us with a map and directions to our bank for the next morning. The hotel was within walking distance of several restaurants and small shops. We walked to Carraba's for dinner that evening. The hotel room itself was clean and quiet. The continental breakfast was a nice assortment of hot and cold items. It was a nice change from the expected cold cereal. We will definitely stay here again the next time we are in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “good value and good experience”
Reviews.Author: brandinecole
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for a short 3 nt Orlando get away and I was impressed with this property. We had been to Orlando the previous year and had stayed onsite at one of Disney's value Resorts. This time we planned on visiting both Sea World and Universal. The location was an easy drive from the airport and within 10-15 mins drive from the main attractions. I would definately note that without a rental car you will have access to shuttle service,however, we did not want to be surrounded by so many people and opted to drive to and from the parks. The resort had a great continental breakfat daily ( however it does tend to be little crowded earlier in the am). The housekeeping was great and they have a nice pool area with an outdoor cabana bar. I have stayed with Comfort Inns in the past and was happy with this as well. My only tip was keep an eye out as they do have onsite "timeshare"people and you kind of have to dodge them or else they try to sell to you on the way to your room from breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay as good as first”
Reviews.Author: FrickandFrack
Reviews.Content: We just completed our second stay at this hotel. I wanted to write another review because sometimes, a second stay isn't as nice as the first. That's not the case here. If you're going to the Kissimmee area for any reason other than a mutli-day visit to the Disney World Resort exclusively, you can't do better than this hotel. The rates are very reasonable, the rooms are absolutely spotless (no weird smells), the beds are great, the sheets are comfortable, the bathrooms are clean and well kept, the rooms are large and comfortable, the pool is and hot tub are way above average, every room's a suite with a sitting area, fridge and microwave; the free breakfast always includes waffles and one hot item in addition to the usual continental fare, and the staff is helpful and gracious. The one thing about this hotel I would mention is that all the mirrors in the room are in the bathroom. This may not seem weird, but if you're travelign with two teenagers who need time to primp, or you're sharing a room with a business associate, that may be inconvenient for you. And we weren't in town for Disney, so i can't really speak to the convenience of the shuttle because we didn't use it. However, we arrived on the autotrain -- exhausted after traveling all night, and the front desk staff bent over backwards to get us in our room early on a holiday weekend when everything was full. The parking is free -- which is always a bonus for me, and the location is very convenient. Our conference as at a Disney Hotel and it was about 10 minutes away, so it's quite close. Plus, there are plenty of meal choices on the strip where the hotel is located, but despite the busy location, the hotel is set back from the road and is very quet. Like many Florida hotels, it does not have interior corridors, but we noticed very little noise. It might be noisier during the busy summer months. The WIFi connection is free and works throughout the complex with no password needed. And the entire property is Non-Smoking -- which I love. I really don't have enough good things to say about this property, and am quite sad that our annual conference is changing cities next year and I have to start hunting a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mttee
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with choice points while visiting Disneyworld- the other nights we stayed with other family members at the Doubletree suites. I would recommend this motel over that one - especially when price is considered. The room was very comfortable with nice decor. There were 2 queen beds and a sleeper sofa. There was plenty of room for the 4 of us. Also had a safe, small fridge, and microwave. The bathroom was quite large and had nice amenities. We had a pool view which was lovely. The only problem we had was when we turned the water on in the sink, there was a large leak under the counter - really large! We called the front desk and they had us moved in minutes. The pool was great and our kids had a great time playing in it. The hot tub was nice but wasn't nearly hot enough - it was barely warm. The location was great and we had no trouble getting to the DisneyMgm park the next day. We had a car and did not use the shuttle so can't comment on that. The breakfast was fine although not memorable. Overall, I thought it was an excellent bargain and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ahlayton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel Nov 4-15. It was our 15th trip to Kissimmee and this hotel was the best so far. - Fast, efficient check in - Telephoned the hotel 1 month ahead to request a quiet room away from the pool - given one at the back of the hotel - # 248 - and it was just what we wanted - Room, grounds, pool immaculate - Continental breakfast far superior to any other "free" breakfast we have ever had - Tons of parking - Outback, Giordano's, Friday's, Cracker Barrel, Carrabas, and Supermarket very close by - definitely within a comfortable strolling distance - Express check out - bill in door morning of checkout - if ok, just sign, leave key cards in room and go - Bathroom huge! Room a very good size - Extensive channels available on TV - Safe (no fee), fridge, microwave in room Definitely will be our pick the next time we return. All this for $915 including taxes, for 11 nights

Reviews.Title: “Great Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: ljsflorida
Reviews.Content: This is the second best Comfort Suites I ever stayed at, the best is by Old Town in Kissimmee just down the road from this one, the breakfast is good the room clean the pool big, all in all a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Zero Complaints”
Reviews.Author: deadheadcouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Suites Maingate from Nov. 7-11 and had quite a nice stay. The location is nice...if you have a car. I can't comment on the shuttle service as we had a car on premisis, but drive time to Disney was only 10 minutes or so and very easy. The hotel seems to have undergone a recent renovation and everything in our room and common areas was neat, clean and well maintained. The only food service is the continental breakfast which is included and fair. Selections include cold cereals, fruit, bagels and bread for toasting, breakfast pastries, one egg dish per day and do-it-yourself waffles...coffee, juice and water. We had the breakfast every morning and were always able to find a table, though there's often a wait for the waffle irons. There is one bar on property, the pool cabana, which is open till 11:00 PM and has a nice selection...upon check-in you'll receive two 2-for-1 coupons for beer, wine or well drinks. There are plenty of chain type restaurants within easy walking distance of this hotel, including Carrabbas, Cracker Barrel, Giordinio's Pizza, etc. Several restaurants deliver to the hotel, including lots of pizza joints. Our room consisted of a small seating area with a couch, coffee table, dining table and two chairs seperated by a small 1/2 wall from the sleeping area. We had two queen beds that were comfortable, with plenty of pillows. Also in the room were a small fridge and microwave. As I mentioned, the rooms looked recently remodeled and were attractive, comfortable and clean. Unfortunately, the weather was cool while we were there, so we didn't use the pool, but the area looked nice. There's a large free-form swimming pool, a smaller kiddie pool with an "umbrella" style waterfall and a nice hot tub. I wish we would have had time and weather to use the pool facilities. There appears to have been only two areas that were not addressed in the renovations...both of which need attention...the heat/air conditioning are very old units and are not effective or accurate in keeping the room an even temperature. Also, the bathroom fans were not replaced and were very ineffective...since the windows don't open either, our room seemed stuffy all week and was steamy/muggy after each shower. Along those same lines, the plumbing is very loud. I mean these as minor suggestions, not complaints...it wasn't enough of a problem to make a fuss. All in all, I think this property presents itself well above the standard rates charged...much better than many hotels I've encountered in this price range. If you're looking for a budget to mid-range hotel and don't mind driving to your chosen attractions, this just might be the spot for you...definitely worth a look at the very least!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: BlushPell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my brother and a couple of friends this past weekend. There were four of us total. We got a room that was not facing the pool (358). I have stayed several times over the years at this hotel. The rooms have been updated since my last stay with more subdued bedding and decor. Although the room is tastefully decorated the carpeting could use a little improvement.(it was ripped and worn but clean). There was plenty of room for the four of us. We used the two double beds and also the sofa bed. Surprisingly the sofa bed was comfortable as well(that is where I ended up). There is a microwave, refrigerator and safe in the room. We had a little trouble with the safe. It is the kind where you enter your four digit code. I have yet to figure those out. We called and in about an hour they had it fixed. There is a coffee maker and hair dryer also. Laundry is available also. The only problem that I had with the room was that the sink area was inside with the rest of the bathroom. I have never found this to be a problem before mostly because I travel with my boyfriend and we share the bathroom, however with four people (or six which is the capacity of the room) it did make getting ready a little bit of a chore. It took longer because if one person was showering noone else could be using the sink etc. The continental breakfast was a little crowded at times but very nice. There was always the usual bagels, donuts, cereal, yogurt and fruit. The other side of the breakfast area had something warm, i.e. biscuit sandwich or mini "omlettes" with bacon and cheese. The waffle maker was going constantly but I got in a few days to make one. They are OK. Nothing to write home about but at least they are warm and the kids loved them. The pool area is well maintained including the hot tub. There are signs that children in diapers are not allowed in the pool area and they have their own separate splash pool as well. Within the parking lot there are all the amenities that you need, a grocery store, liquor store, drug store, Taco Bell, Outback, TGI Friday's, Carrabas. We tried to eat at the Carrabas but had the rudest waiter so we walked out. He was angry that we all did not partake in the 2 for 1 drink specials that were going on. We had asked for waters and he rudely snapped "Don't worry I'll bring you waters!" Well he never did. He brought it to the next table that were seated after us. I am a patient person but we are talking a good span of time at least 15 minutes from the time he yelled to the time we walked out. Hopefully if you decide to eat there you will receive better service. If I could remember his name I would tell you but I guess I've blocked it out. Sorry. There is also a mini golf course in the same parking lot if you need some entertainment for the little ones. You can access the internet for 15 minutes a day in the hotel lobby. Just ask at the desk and they will give you a code for it. You can also print pages for $1 each. The only downside in the hotel lobby is the time share people. I tried to avoid them but I got nabbed one morning, she was polite until I said "no", as is usually the case with time share people. The coupons and discounts are located around the time share desk so if you don't want to be hassled sneak down later at night they are not there. All in all I have enjoyed my stay here and would stay here again. The price cannot be beat for the location our average room rate was $71 a night for four people. This hotel has everything that you will need without being overly fancy or overly Disney(which was not why we were there). If you have any questions about the hotel or other things in the area please feel free to ask away.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!!”
Reviews.Author: jvjcr
Reviews.Content: Comfort Suites Maingate Date: Oct. 10 From: Biloxi, Ms. If you are like me, reviews mean everything. I searched every review on this hotel before I booked with Choice Privileges. This hotel is very clean and had lots of room. We had trouble with the bathroom door not locking, but other then that it was nice. I usually do not stay at hotels with an outside coridor, but I gave this one a chance because it is an award winner. The hotel and the pool area was just beautiful. I was so impressed with the cleanliness of the rooms and the grounds. The pool area was beautifully landscaped. The free breakfast was really nice. We would stay here again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great night's sleep! Great value!”
Reviews.Author: rav5family
Reviews.Content: Amazed to hear my 10 year old and 9 year old making a big deal about the comfortable beds and pillows! My wife jokingly said she was going to buy them pillows from the hotel for Christmas and they were delighted! Great value for a family - no question. Great service checking in at midnite after closing Magic Kingdom. Room was quiet, though air conditioner was a little noisy. But soft comfortable beds more than made up for it and my sometimes difficult-to-please wife said she hadn't had such a good night's sleep in a long time. Everyone was very happy with the continental breakfast which included sausage/egg/cheese biscuits (Sunday special?) in addition to the "world-famous" waffles (read other reviews!). All staff was pleasant and professional. Lots of convenient restaurants & easy trip to Disney (didn't use shuttle). We only stayed one night but I know wife and kids will insist we stay here for future trips!

Reviews.Title: “Well..besides the urine incident..”
Reviews.Author: davissummer24
Reviews.Content: Checkin: Went pretty smooth except for the high speed internet. I called ahead to get info about using the in room high speed and was told it wouldn't be a problem. They had wireless cards availabe at the desk to borrow. They left out the fact that you had to have a 100dollar hold put on your credit card to borrow one. That's an important piece of info to know ahead of time Room: Had a king bed room with view of parking lot. Clean, spacious. Microwave and fridge worked without problem. Bed was very comfy with at least 6 pillows. Breakfast/snack bar: I did find the breakfast room crowded some mornings, some mornings not. I saw the posted sign that says not to take food to your room but on those crowded days I did take my meal to my room without incident. Eggs, waffles, muffins, bagels and assorted juices. Basic decent breakfast. Snack bar by the pool didn't open until 4 and as I was there to lounge around during the day I usually had to leave the hotel for lunch. Had a pizza from there which tasted like basic microwave fare. Had a beer with the two for 1 coupons but ended up stocking the fridge with beer to save a few bucks Pool: Never crowded. Most days I was the only one there til about 4 or 5 pm. Plenty of loungers but no shade unless you want to sit at a table. Tried to buy an umbrella but CVS and Walgreens in the area did not have any. Decent size for the hotel and the hot tub was a nice plus THE INCIDENT: I was all set to give the hotel 3 or 4 stars until I was stepping out of the shower one morning to have someone else's urine and fecal matter dumped on my head through the ceiling vent. Upon calling the front desk, maintenance came up and informed me that the toilet above me was stopped up and they were working on it. I informed the front desk and maintence that I had been standing right under the vent when this started and I got an apology and a fruit basket. This blew it for me. I believe I should at least been comped one night stay or something equilavent. I do alot of traveling and this is the most disgusting thing to ever happen to me. What kind of plumbing system do they have I wonder?They did give me a new room with a pool view as the leaking spread to the carpet. I'm not sure if I would stay again. I was fairly pleased with the hotel until this point but I just can't get passed urine being dumped on me. You decide

Reviews.Title: “Awesome summer stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate in Kissimmee!”
Reviews.Author: rachealp86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Comfort Inn in Kissimmee, FL for 3 nights in mid-July 2007--he was visiting me during his 2 week leave from Iraq. We loved our stay!! After a 6 hour traffic-plagued drive to Kissimmee, we were so happy to get to our room and it was even nicer than we expected. Rather than the cheap, bright, mis-matched colors that many hotels decorate their rooms in, our room was done in very modern, clean, light colors, with black & white tropical framed pictures on the walls. The bed was so comfortable and loaded with pillows, and the room was very spacious. There was a table with chairs and a couch, plus a very nice fridge & microwave area that even had glass drinking cups. The bathroom sink area had more than enough space for our stuff, and we had plenty of towels and toiletries. We were also surprised to find that the bath tub was MUCH bigger than any standard hotel tub we've ever seen. We only had a couple small problems with the room: the knob to adjust the water heat in the shower was very confusing and it was hard to tell whether or not it was getting hotter or colder until it hit you; the air conditioner had a mind of its own, and sometimes it wouldn't kick on, or if we tried to turn the air on low it would just kick off and not come back on for a very long time--it wasn't too bad though and didnt start acting up until our last day; lastly, I didn't like that the room itself had no mirrors in it--only the bathroom did. It had lots of wall mirrors and a full length mirror where you could watch yourself on the toilet!--haha. The pool was nice and big, but we didn't swim it it. We tried the hot tub one evening for a while, but since its summer, it was hard to stay in the hot water for long. We got drinks at the poolside bar with the 2-for-1 drink coupons the front desk gave us. It was really a good deal because we got 2 mixed drinks for only $4.50, and they had lots of selections. The girl at the bar did not seem very pleased to help guests though. The lobby was actually really useful because they had tons of brochures & coupons--we used the brochures to help us decide on a couple places to go. The free wireless internet was also a huge plus! We went down to breakfast a couple times, but it was unbelievably packed--it was like an overly full restaurant. I felt bad for the guy responsible for refilling the food because he sure had his work cut out for him! I was really pleased with the breakfast selection though--cheesy scrambled eggs, sausage, lots of breads, doughnuts, sweet rolls, cereal, yogurt, fruit, waffles, and on and on! It was almost a fight to get through the line. I have stayed at plenty of hotels, and the breakfast areas are ALWAYS packed--don't expect anything different--people love free food. The landscaping around the hotel is beautiful, and we occupied ourselves one night by looking at the different signs they placed near some of plants to tell you what they are. The location of the hotel is perfect! It is in walking distance of a shopping center, and we walked over several times to eat, once at Cracker Barrell and once at some Italian restaurant. It is within short driving distance of all kinds of fun places in Kissimmee--we went to Medieval Times dinner & tournament and had an amazing time, and also went to Sea World, which took only 15 minutes to drive to. We didn't leave until 11:00am to noon on most days, so housekeeping always came back to our room after we left and cleaned it without us even asking, which was really nice. We did not use any of the hotel's shuttle services or gift shop, so I am not sure about those. Overall, we had an amazing stay and we would definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: ncgirl79
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself, and my in-laws, shared one king bed suite comfortably. We stayed for 3 nights while visiting Disney World. The room was very well kept up, with the bathroom and room looking as though it had been recently remodeled. The service was great, I called to get extra towels and they were there within 5 minutes. The value for this hotel was great, with a good breakfast selection in the morning included in the price. Would definitely stay here again for future Disney trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very up-kept property”
Reviews.Author: FloridafunNaplesFL
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a few years ago and found it very clean and well maintained. I called the hotel directly while I was in Orlando because we were transferring from another hotel that we were displeased with. At first I was quoted $149.00 for a pool room (which I may add would have been too much money to spend on the room); I was told they raised the price because they had just renovated the rooms. But, since we had stayed there a few years ago the price was lowered to $110.00. They really maintain this property very well. As I remember a few years ago they were putting in new furnishings-- and upon this stay the furniture had changed once again. Our room was clean, with beautiful comforters, and it looked freshly painted with new carpeting. We had a nice size mini refrigerator with microwave. We have a family of 5 so the room can get a bit small. One of the drawbacks is that they do not have an outside sink (as it makes getting ready a bit delayed in the morning). The breakfast was fine and you can help yourself to: coffee, fruit, waffles, yogurt, cereal, juice, muffins, bagels (and a egg special that changed dailey) a nice assortment in my book -- At times it was crowed, but we always found a seat -- either inside or outside by the pool. The pool area is very nice and it offers a poolside bar. The place also has a small game room. We only found one problem upon check in -- it was the sales person (for time shares) who hunted us down in the gift shop while I was waiting for my son to come out of the restroom. Honestly, we were just there to do a fast check-in as we were headed for the parks that morning-- I aready had our tickets and I did not want to be bothered with a presentation. -- This woman kept on giving me directions (which we did not need). Finally, she saw that I was becoming very irritated and let us go. Other than that our stay was great. There is also a plaza next door and a lot of restaurants. TGI Friday, pizza place, Carabas, subway, dairy queen etc. and a grocery store. The hotel is off of 192 and sits further back, so it's nice and quite. It's also close to I -4 when traveling to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “An okay family value but fix the breakfast situation!”
Reviews.Author: DLDVienna_VA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located on 192, within a 5 minute drive to Disney. The rooms are clean (but a tad small to be called a suite) with microwave, small fridge, and a full-size sofabed. The pools are family-friendly and considered above average for this type of hotel but can be somewhat noisy at night. The disappointing aspect of my stay was the breakfast experience. Its a continental-style buffet breakfast and does offer self-serve waffles and sometimes scrambled eggs that taste like they've been overcooked. What made the experience bad was the breakfast buffet was always packed with people, who exhibited behavior that can best be described as "Lord of the Flies"-like. It certainly was survival of the fittest, when it came to serving yourself. Also, there were only a few tables in the breakfast room, so almost everyone took their breakfast items to their room, which was highly discouraged by the hotel management. This breakfast situation needs to be fixed immediately. Until this is addressed by hotel management, my family and I will not return to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: zoeyNewfoundland
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel!! The staff are great, the place is SPOTLESS, the breakfast is awesome, the location is very close to Disney, the pool is GREAT and my family and I felt very safe there. IF YOU ARE GOING TO KISSIMMEE CHECK OUT THE COMFORT SUITES MAINGATE - you won't be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed”
Reviews.Author: SesameOntario
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the room, pool area, grounds, lobby and eating area.... very clean and spacious. A little dissappointed we were charged an extra $10 a night for pool view, but overall the price was good. The pool did get a little noisy in the evening... drowned out the noise with the air conditioner. Loved the in-room fridge and micro. Really loved the location. Close to Disney and tons of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Andrea S
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Spotless. Loved the jasmine in the walkways. I would recommend a room away from the pool, along the back of the buildings. It is quieter away from the pool. Beautiful bedding. Had small problem with air conditioner, fixed immediately by a really nice maintenance guy. Walked through parking lot to Winn Dixie grocery store for salad and chicken for dinner. Lots of good restaurants to walk to, also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Comfort Suites Maingate”
Reviews.Author: CanadaTripHopper
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the Comfort Suites Maingate in Kissimmee. We will definitely stay there again and will recommend it to friends. Friends that were staying on another resort (5 star) nearby were also very impressed. The property is clean, well managed and the rooms were very roomy, modern and spotless. We had lots of towels, a fridge, microwave and plenty of extra bedding. The continental breakfast was very good and had a nice selection of healthier breakfast options not always available. We were pleasantly surprised as we usually stay at higher end resorts but we found all of our needs were met. The location is great as there are many restaurants, and shops within walking distance and it is a short drive (5-10 mins) to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: yellowgolf21
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. This hotel was simply fantastic. The room was clean. The breakfast was great. My family of 4 had a great time. We would stay there again. Hotel offers shuttle to the parks but make sure you check the schedule. They leave at 7:30 or 10:30. Breakfast is from 7:00-10:00. The pool was clean and very warm.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Maingate”
Reviews.Author: CSpadt
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so clean and well maintained. The breakfast every morning was awesome! Had a great variety of breakfast foods (including Mickey waffle iron)! I loved that the beddings and pillows were new and clean. The fact that you could walk to alot of places for dinner or lunch was sooo convenient too! I would definitely come back to this hotel! Our family of four felt right at home!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: KiaMaria
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Suites Maingate last year in February and loved it so much we stayed there again for our holiday this year. The hotel is located in an ideal spot with fantastic restaurants and a Winn Dixie all within walking distance. The free shuttle to Disney, Sea World and Universal is such a money saver for those of us who didn't rent a car. Last year we found the rubber backed mattress protector quite uncomfortable but the hotel had gotten rid of them this year which was a nice surprise. The new color theme in the room was very attractive as well. The pool and surrounding area is large, very warm and always very clean. The poolside bar is a nice feature too!! The continental breakfast is very good however sometimes the room fills up and you may have to sit outside. This isn't usually an issue as the weather is always wonderful! Finally, we found the staff to be accommodating and friendly. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: JohninDC
Reviews.Content: Great value and location. Close to WDW with lots of family friendly places within walking distance of the hotel. Room w/one king and a sofa was spotless and fine for two. The pool was good and the 2-for-1 drink coupons were a nice bonus.

Reviews.Title: “3/6/2007”
Reviews.Author: micheletwo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is awesome! My family of 5 stayed here from 3/6/07-3/16/07 and were very comfortable. Brand new modern bedding. (the pictures do not do this hotel justice) The pool was awesome! This hotel is very clean. You can tell management takes pride in keeping everything in tip top shape. The staff was friendly. On top of that you get a FREE breakfast. Hard boiled eggs, mickey mouse eared shapped waffles, cererals, fruites, donuts, bagles, toast and more!! I have stated at 4 star hotels who have not messured up to this one. I think it is right up there.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: leisuretraveler74
Reviews.Content: The motel was great. The room was very clean, the courtyard area was beautiful, and breakfast was offered every day. We had a refrigerator and microwave, room safe, sofa bed, and table and chairs. The bathroom was very large - only thing I would change is I personally like a sink outside the bathroom but that's just me. I would gladly stay here again. We were treated very well and had no problems. Area is fairly quiet - no traffic noises. Restaurants and shopping are within walking distance. Location is easy to get to all the major parks and airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for a good price”
Reviews.Author: travelwanderer
Reviews.Content: We paid $68 a night. Most of the hotels nearby charged $20 more and offered the same type of room. The room was nice and clean. Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “poor value”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoAtlanta
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here on Tripadvisor, I booked a room at Comfort Suites Maingate in Kissimmee for 3 nights just after Christmas, choosing it over other motels in the area because so many reviewers seemed to have liked it. I would not stay there again. First of all, it being the height of the tourist season, they charged $149/night when I booked through Comfort Suites web site (Choice Hotels), which came out to $135 or so with AAA discount--no bargain here. There are many nearby hotels, some closer to the Disney approach road. (For those of you who are not familiar with the Disney World area, this hotel is over a mile from the entrance to the approach road, and after that it's another several miles to the Magic Kingdom and other Disney parks.) Anyway, while I can say Comfort Suites Maingate is clean and well-kept, several things irked me, which may have been less bothersome if I had paid $65 or $75, but for $135 I expected better. The bed was uncomfortable because the mattress pad was like one of those waterproof plastic baby diapers. It felt like sleeping on a thick sheet of plastic, which bunched up and stuck in our backs uncomfortably. Such a mattress pad is expected in a cheap motel, but not a mid-priced Comfort Suites. Also, the bedspread and blanket had cigarette burns in them. Again, fine for a cheap motel, but not a mid-priced Comfort Suites. Moreover, at check-in, I was asked to initial that I understood I would be charged $200 if someone smoked in my (non-smoking) room. After seeing the results of someone having smoked in MY room (well, having smoked on the bedspread and blanket that were now in my room), I felt like I should have charged THEM $200 for having to tolerate such a disgusting bed in a NON-SMOKING room. I am also totally perplexed by glowing comments from some previous reviewers about the pool, bar, friendly service, etc. I felt it was just an ordinary motel like many others I have stayed at, with an ordinary pool, tiny "bar," typical motel complimentary breakfast, etc.. Nothing special here. I think you may end up feeling misled if you stay here because there are a relatively large number of very good reviews while there are fewer good reviews for other hotels in the area. I suspect other hotels in the same area are on par with this one. I also suspect that the people who paid $65 felt that what they got was good for the price. I recognize that I stayed there on perhaps the absolute peak days, when hotels charge the most, but I was nevertheless disappointed. I will take Tripadvisor reviews with a grain of salt in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mom2NY
Reviews.Content: The Good For the price I feel this was a great value hotel. We stayed in first week of Dec. 2006 and paid $62 (week day) and $72 (fri/sat) triple A rate but they never asked to see our triple A card. The room was capable of sleeping 6 - we were 2 adults and 2 small children and the room was more than adequate. Hotel provided us with a pack and play which fit between the two beds. The room came with fridge, microwave, coffee maker and safe. Overall the hotel seemed very clean. Free breakfast was included every morning from 6am-10am. More than adequate food - bagles, toast, muffins, waffles, yogurt, coffee, juice, cereal etc...Pool and area was nice and clean. Hot tub relaxing. Very close to Disney. Extremely close to grocery store and restaurants and fast food all along 192 - some walking distance. I found the elevator quick and convenient. The bad - and this is just nit picky stuff because I feel I got more than $62 worth of hotel. The room carpet had some stains - as did bathroom floor - though overall I felt the room was mostly clean and much cleaner and fresher than other hotels for this price. I found the lighting in the room was not very bright because all the bulbs in all the lamps were those energy efficient bulbs. But during the day with the blinds open the room was light and airy. Biggest issue is that the sink/ vanity/ mirrors are all inside the bathroom...so if someone is using the bathroom everyone else cant use those other things...not one mirror outside the bathroom - weird. Wasnt a problem for us though!! I felt fairly safe (Im always on alert in strange places) but I would say anyone could easilly walk right onto the premisses. Though I feel that is the situation in most of these hotels that have outside corridors. We were there at a fairly quiet time of year and everything was quiet but I could see how the breakfast area could totally be overrun during the busy times. We moved on to stay at Disneys Wilderness Lodge for a few nights after this which was AWESOME!! (but even that had a stagnent oder in the bathroom) and it was TRIPLE the price. I would totally recommend this hotel to a friend. I think its a great bang for your buck. You get the free breakfast included. You get a hotel with a kiddie pool and hot tub. Very clean. For someone on a tight budget this is a highly adequate hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody at the desk at night. Security = 0”
Reviews.Author: Ultimatetravelking
Reviews.Content: Like the last reviewer said, this is not a suite but a large hotel room. The biggest problem we had on our two night stay was that there was no one manning the front desk after 10 pm. We waited for five minutes at 10:30 pm on the first night to check in, but there was no one attending the front desk. After yelling everywhere we could think of, the attendant finally popped out of the back room behind the desk. The same thing the second night - we get back at 10 pm and nobody is at the desk and customers are trying to check in. My biggest concern was that there was no security. Anyone could walk in with no one at the front desk. Here is the good; Price Clean large room Location Here is the bad; No front desk attendant at night The tiny elevators are a nightmare. Be prepared to wait 10 minutes after you push the button. The hallways have bad breath. Lots of noise in the hallways

Reviews.Title: “More a spacious motelroom than suites”
Reviews.Author: Andrea13
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Suites is located at the western end of 192, behind a Cracker Barrel, away from the noisy highway. Arriving at this place you get an impressive look of the huge entrance and will enter a huge lobby area. Very modern, new, in bright colours and well lit in the evening. Spacious front desk with friendly staff on the one side, information desk (that sells tickets) at the other side. Some comfortable sofas in the middle of the lobby. Front desk staff did forget to tell us we need some extra password for using the complimentary internet so it did not work out immediately. Signal was way to low anyway. Passing through the lobby you may enter the pool area with a huge shaped pool and plenty of sitting area around. 3 sides of the pool are surrounded by the rooms, the 4th side by the huge lobby building. Unfortunately it was too chilli to use the pool. There is a tiki bar at the pool and you receive a 2 for one coupon at arrival, to be used for alcoholic beverages. The whole complex is surrounded by a parking lot and all rooms have outdoor corridors, very motel style. We got a room on the back of the building, and it was very quiet, except you might hear some guests arrive and slam doors or shout. No noise from adjacent bathrooms, but once we heard people talking in the neighbouring room. The motel has 3 floors and you can reach the upper floors by stairs or using the elevator in the corner of the building. The room was really huge, but not what I expect to be a suite. It was devided into 2 parts by a small wall – sitting area with sofa and table, desk and chairs, and sleeping area with 2 queen beds. All in bright wood and brown colours. There was a big screened TV with more than 50 channels, but most of the channels were not clear, which made no fun viewing their films. In the morning television did not work at all. We got a safe in the room and a big refridgerator as well as a microwave. No kitchen as you would expect from a suite. Probably cheaper rooms have none. Beds must have had some kind of plastic sheets so you might sweat a bit more than usual. There is a coffee maker in the bathroom and a small closet with hangers and ironing equipment in the room. My husband used coffee maker which was really clean. Bathroom was separate with tub, toilet and sink with huge counter. Plenty of space for your stuff and nice toiletries are provided. Lots of thick fluffy towels! Took some time to get hot water. Nice big massage shower head. New and clean shower curtains and tub that was not too small. Bathroom door was sticky, needs to be cleaned. The whole place was clean, not perfectly, but ok for us. The blankets had some stains, so did the wall besides the toilet and the fabric of one chair. The carpets looked a bit worn though the rest of the room furniture seemed to be new. There was no complimentary breakfast in the morning which gives you the chance to go to one of the buffets along 192.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay! Clean, economical, safe!”
Reviews.Author: KitKatluvr2
Reviews.Content: We traveled all over Florida in August and this was by far the best hotel of our stay! Rooms are large, very clean, comfortable, and the area was very safe. Rooms include a programmable safe, compact refrigerator, coffeemaker, sofa(bed), etc. We were on the second floor and did not have any noise issues whatsoever. The pool was huge and very clean! They also had a kiddie pool with a mushroom waterfall, and a hot tub that I never visited. My kids went back and forth from the kiddie pool to the large pool (right next to each other), and had a great time. The large pool was heated and very comfortable. We did NOT come for Disney, which was great, because we practically had the pool all to ourselves during the daytime! The only downside was that the breakfast area (though HUGE) was extremely crowded. It was a madhouse. At any given time during breakfast hours there were over 100 people in the breakfast area! The hotel could use more staffing for breakfast because the poor guy filling the stations could not begin to keep up! It doesn't help when selfish people (with no social manners whatsoever) hold up lines for 15 minutes while they make 6 waffles for their entire table!!! I also witnessed people grabbing fruit out of the employee's hands as he brought it out and tried to replenish the supply! People's manners are not the hotel's fault; however, if the staffing and supply had been adequate there would not have been so much chaos. I would highly recommend this hotel! (Just plan on eating at 6:30 a.m.! before it gets crowded!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a 5 night stay. The kids loved the pool (they even give you pool towels along with bath towels), the husband loved the bar at the pool, I loved the whole thing. The rooms were spacious and clean. There were two security guards that we saw, and cameras in the hallways. There is a guest laundry on the second floor, which came in handy. The breakfast room was small, but they have tables set up outside so you can eat there if it is too crowded. The location was excellent, the plaza next door has everything you need. We drove to the parks and even with traffic it didnt take more than 10 minutes. The only negative thing about the trip had nothing to do with the hotel. There is alot of construction in the area and it makes it kind of hard to navigate, especially if you don't know where you are going. All in all it was a great stay and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we loved staying at this hotel... we wanted to go back this year and stay there again.....my elderly mother became ill just before we arrived a few days before...she wanted to come with us so the doctor said it would be ok for her to travel...we went to sea world and epcot and then were going to go to disney world ..the day that we were going to go to disney world my mother was not feeling so well so she told us she would stay at the hotel and rest.... my children loved the pool at this hotel so much we decided to not go to disney world and stayed at the hotel pool instead and we had the time of our lives that day...i think the pool was so warm and inviting that when we were done for the day our bodies were waterlogged....my mother felt bad about the kids not going to disney....my kids told her don't feel bad memere' we loved the swimming pool and we had just as much fun there and had a good time anyway...the breakfast was great.. we saved so much money eating our breakfast there and were so full from all the things they had to eat we skipped lunch and just had an early dinner that evening....things were close so we didn't have to venture far for things....my mother had to go to the doctors office and that was even close....i would stay here again....and again and again.....the people were nice here too

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for 6 people/room”
Reviews.Author: wendyton
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 2 night stay. There was a large group of us so we rented 2 rooms for 1 night and 3 rooms for the second night. They placed us all next door to one another, which was very nice. The room was large enough for 6 people per room to sleep and with a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and safe it had everything we needed. We walked to TGI Fridays the first night and drove to Winn Dixie (only because we needed to transport stuff back to the room). The heated pool was nice, and the hot tub came in handy after travelling all day. The game room has about 8 games and my nephew enjoyed that, but the game room was freezing so don't go in there after going in the pool. The food was good and everything that is expected from a continental breakfast, plus a make your own waffle area, seating area was small but about averae with other hotels I've stayed at. We just went to MGM and VERY convenient to there. It took about 15 minutes and signage was very good. Rooms and grounds were very clean. For $80/night that sleeps 6 people it was a great deal as most hotels only sleep 4.

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip. My wife, 3-year-old, and I stayed here. Don't get me wrong, for the price I wasn't expecting much, but based on the rave reviews on this site, I thought I'd be pleasantly surprised. Well, I wasn't. The pool area was quite nice, but that's where my compliments end. I did not like the room. I'm won't be one of those Internet-hotel-review crazies that list every little thing that I didn't like about it. Instead, I'll just say that overall the room is quite ugly and uncomfortable. But it's clean and just barely functionable, so if that's all you care about, then they'll do. As for the breakfast, in exchange for it being free, this hotel seems to have felt it necessary that it must be served in a room that's the size of a postage stamp. And oh yeah, the hotel is not quite a close to Disney as I thought it would be. The two miles of road from this hotel to the road that leads to Disney (not Disney itself) can take 15 minutes to travel because of the traffic. So, while it's a plus that its located next to a great shopping center, it's not quite as convenient to Disney as some reviewers (and the hotel itself) lead you to believe. Overall I give this hotel an "eh" and I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay! This hotel is in a great location adjacent to Formosa Gardens Shopping Plaza, where you can walk to pick up groceries and other items, as well as a liquor store, Dairy Queen, Subway, Outback Steakhouse, Red Lobster and a host of other nice restaurants. Very clean, daily maid service, wonderful staff, pool/spa area very nice and well kept. The pool was heated and just wonderful after a long day, hot tub very large and never overcrowded. Family friendly all the way, and very quiet at night. With free continental breakfast every day, good access to the parks, shops and restaurants, it's a great stay for the budget minded. The one drawback is the courtesy shuttle service, which runs on a limited schedule. This could be a hassle for some, you may be better off with car rental if you want to come and go as you please.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully clean, we're coming back!”
Reviews.Author: andreanicole
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, would recommend to anyone coming to the Orlando area to see the theme parks. The hotel was *very* clean, staff was pleasant, helpful and willing to please, and the pool is awesome, although they do use a lot of chlorine. The complimentary breakfast in the morning includes juices, fresh coffee and tea, fresh fruit, bagles, toast, cereal, oatmeal, and a make-your-own waffle bar. We didn't have to eat out for breakfast once! The pool was kept sparkling and the pool area free of litter and tidy. We had a great time relaxing our sore muscles in the hot tub after touring the parks all day. However, don't count on the curtosy shuttle to take you to Disney/Universal/Sea World -- it only leaves once at day (9:45 am) and comes back later than most parks are open during the week (7:45pm). The hotel is also in the same parking lot as a Cracker Barrel and adjacent to a Winn-Dixie, Subway, TGI Friday's, and walk-in clinic. I hope you enjoy as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 days and 7 nights end of January to February. Pluses included good housekeeping, in-room safe, frig pretty large, armoire, extra blanket, coffeemaker, hair dryer, shopping center nearby with clinic, supermarket!, restaurants. There was a great breakfast with bagels, breads, muffins, donuts, hard-boiled eggs, fruit salad and sliced grapefruit and oranges, bananas, some cereals, choice of teas and coffees and handmade waffles. This was all free! closeby to ponderosa and highways. Negatives: walls thin and lots of screaming at times from preteens holding party near pool and then, after we moved away from the pool, screaming from irate parents to their children while we were trying to sleep at 11pm at night( exhausted!). Breakfast room got occ. crowded. Front desk told me on arrival no rooms were available away from the pool on the first night but then after the first noisy night (to 1 am), we went back to change rooms in the morning. Suddenly, with another front desk attendant, the rooms not facing the pool were available. I had a hunch they were available all along but the front desk wanted to charge me the extra 10.00 for the pool-side room- so I was paying more money for extra noise. Not logical. bottomline: good deal for the money but bring earplugs and patience and book a room away from the pool.

Reviews.Title: “loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we loved the comfort suites, the rooms were immaculate, the staff were very helpfull and friendly .the rooms were cleaned to a very high standard every day and we will definately be booking for next year !!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Suites Maingate
HotelInfo.Address: 7888 W. Irlo Bronson Hwy, Kissimmee, FL 34747
